cumbersome high mountaines repaired sea coast along hiding within vallies full lurking hole toward darke night especially moone new first quarter therefore yet shining full light observed na tices shippemasters saylers perceiued layed along sleepe creeping foure among anchorgables going softly heard conveyed slyly shippeboats stood hard ere aware thus greedie covetousnesse gave fire unto within could find nothing thither brought leaving sea coast went lycaonia adjoyning hard unto isauria within thicke growne fastness forefences manner lye ambush passe maintained enriched good well else driuen upon extreame necessitie valiantly fight overwhelmd laid along fall huge weighty peeces thenceforth therefore due observation warie circumspection made ever robber began make towards high virgine unbestowed ashamed long absence poore father adaies happily thou good honest man come stranger unto one great monied men puffed pride full bagges thy duty way salutation first thou findest entertainement right welcome wishedfor guest many sundry question asked whereby thou art forced make lye thou wonderest never seene great man thus affectionately favoureth thee meane person insomuch repenteth thee thou hadst seene tenne yeares sooner happy day principall felicitie thus presuming confidently upon romane courteous affabilitie thou doe next morrow thou art stand thy selfe one altogether unknowne come suddaine while wonderous encourager heartened thee much yesterday doubt long time thou shouldest whence thou art come length agnized taken ranke friend thou shew thy selfe vanitie pride esteeme bred borne without wals citie bee base worth unlesse childlesse unmaried folke incredible obsequious loating courting rome sundry way person without child much among head place world grievous disease reigne rage highest degree allaying assuaging whereof art physicke force devised preservative helpefull meane therefore wit man visite see friend suffereth malady among warie caution proviso another effectuall remedie ordained namely servant beene sent enquire acquaintance doe held disease receive house againe cleansed body bathe fearefull even infection men eye onely seene yet carefull point save shall enfeebled otherwise much weakened lims bee requested marriage gold offered hollow right hand goe lustily nimbly ynough even farre spoleto spoletium well course serious memorable thing bee gone hand rome therefore returne unto text chap vi gallus taketh pleasure spilling man bloud manageth affaire unfortunately commaundement constantius admonished hereof maketh tumult whereupon ensueth horrible bloudshed east caesar time given head unto licentiousnes became burdenous offensive good men henceforth using meane measure plagued part east sparing neither honorable person principall burgess noble city inferior common fine chiefe master reverend order state antioch vertue one writ z warrant commaunded put death enraged wood hereupon season urged instantly cheapnesse low price set market time generall scarcitie feared answered hard unreasonable tearmes convenient died every mother sonne case honoratus come lieutenant generall east time firme resolution withstood proceeding also obscure covert signe crueltie tooke delight bloudie sport cirque shew place joyed see six seven combates otherwhiles forbidden champion wounding killing one another behold agore bloud forsooth gained rich great booty besides purpose forward ynough selfe mischiefe set fire vile base woman let palace required disclosed conspiracie made knowne certaine souldiors meanest reckoning condition layd wait secretly whereat constantina much rejoycing husband life beene secured safe ever rewarded highly setting coach sent herforth palace gate open streetes allurement might intice others also discover like greater treason gallus minding make journey hieropolis hal pp nio hierapolis end outward shew might personally seene voyage whereas comminaltie antioch humbly besought remove dread famine many weighty reason spera atur feared would shortly ensue manner prince large power prerogative yeeld remedie time time locall publique distress take order dispose victual transported province bordering upon unto multitude fearing utmost extremity appointed theophilus called consul ornament deputy president syria stood hard governour replying continually unto tearmes man could want food governour unwilling thereto speech incensed boldnesse baser sort scarcitie victual grew still upon hunger furie withall instigation one eubulus man much reputation among set fire stately gorgeous house burnt foresaid governour one delivered unto imperiall iudgement layed spurned heeles knocked well soundly fistes hee halfe dead piteously mangled tare peeces whose lamentable death every man considering destruction one like perill owne person upon fresh example afraid semblable measure time serenianus late ex duce du first l warden inland march lesse authority come ever since name honourable pancirol notitiam l warden march whose slacknesse cowardise related otherwise called coelesyria coele phoenice harried wasted accused high treason justly endited according law uncertaine favour mediation could acquit manifestly convicted sent familiar friend cap wherewith used cover head enchaunted meanes sorcerie unlawfull art unto idolltemple oracle enquire expressely whether foresignified unto empire firme sure desired thus one time fell joynt twofold mischiefe theophilus guiltlesse person cut horrible accident serenianus also deserved curse men went away cleare harmelesse blamelesse notwithstanding publique force justice manner openly gainsayd prankes constantius hearing anone informed particular beside relation thalassius understood already remooved departed ordinary course writing kind maner unto caesar little little abridged mean maintenance making faire semblant himselfe much disquieted feare souldiors little employment therefore commonly given tumultuous conspire complot destruction commaunded rest contented take trained company palatine souldiors b protectores together c scutarij gentile charged domitianus late high e treasurer praefect iustice come syria gentle modest tearmes set forward gallus journey oftentimes heard say made hast italy sooner domitian arrived antioch whither hastened speed could regard commission passing hard palace gate contemning caesar well beseemed given seeing went praetorium f goodly pompe solemne shew pretending along time sicknesse excuse neither set foot within palace went abroad citie keeping close plotted many mean bring destruction putting report unnecessarie matter beside purpose otherwhiles sent unto prince last entreated admitted counsel chamber consistorie g without circumstance word way preface premised inconsiderately ynough bluntly gone caesar quoth hee commaunded know make stay cause forthwith provision maintenance selfe palace carried away peremptory speech thus malapartly delivered departed somewhat angry came afterwards sight although often sent hereupon gallus al fume chafe one suffered injury indignity committed said prefect ward custodie trustie pentioners guard montius understood time treasure questor h man verily rigorous nature yet somewhat enclined mildnesse called unto chiefe palatine trained company spake unto mild gentle tearmes saying neither meet expedient thus doe proceeding withall word chiding accent liked allowed course statue constantine cast downe might lesse feare certainly devise take away praefects emperours life also gallus taking knowledge hereof faring serpent dart shot stone flung abiding utmost hope seeking save himselfe meanes commaunded souldiors assemble armes stood astonied whetting gnashing teeth prest quoth right valiant men assist ieopardie together behold montius strange unwonted humor swelling pride muttering word chargeth u rebel spurner sacred maiesty emperour displeased sooth angry commaunded regard feare onely malapart stout praefect made himselfe ignorant course world state requireth kept inward said militarie men desirous many time stirres trouble without longer stay first set upon montius whose lodging hard weerish old man sickly hairie cord bound fast legges drew stride long without intermission farre praetorium praefecti house appointed praefect praefects dismembred unseemely manner taken fill revenge cast soone river men outrageous desperat even wood againe one luscus governour citie suddainly sight incensed attempt wicked designes together sthenelaus hold brevitie commendable cutting impertinent unseasonable delay defalketh nothing knowledge necessarie materiall point gallus yet noricum devested royall robe apodemius firebrand kindler broyles long manner flatterie extolled vertue felicitie emperour skie whose becke two prince namely veteranio gallus although diver time manner common souldiors better thus cassed exquisite fine affectation faire word lifted supposing co fidently thenceforth freed displeasure harmes incident unto mortall men forth declined justice intemperately would sticke avouch maintaine eternitie much spoken enditing writing owne hand tearmed himselfe lord whole world men said part ought taken foule skorne indignitie laboured withall earnest endevour gave frame life compose behaviour example patterne civile prince say rule infinite world democritus making inciting anaxarchus alexander great dreamed considered withall reading hearing mathematician one accord agree compasse whole earth unto u seemeth unmeasurable became quite forgotten tract east much missed wished home abroad onely dreadfull enemie unto persian nation magnanimous knight stood unmooveable accident whatsoever heedfull warie hee might seeme overbasely cast himselfe downe despaire yet grieving groning heart innocencie sure place safe repose one regard heavily appaied friend heretofore flocked revolted mightier side much like unto officer sergeant according custome wont goe old master new magistrats successor moreover colleague arbetio faire shew counterfeit courtesie calling many time valiant warriour hee passing skilfull laying traines entrap man plaine simple conversation withall day great authoritie proved heavie friend set himselfe sore like serpent ground lying close hidden within hole observing every one passeth fiercely suddaine assaileth even joyning office also warfare unto power hurt neither harmed time much provoked polluted conscience unsatiable purpose doe mischiefe well forced making captaines privie secret closely breake emperour reveale mind agreed beene night following vrsicinus caried violently away farre sight souldiors killed without condemnation even time past report domitius corbulo trustie wise defendor province murthered troublous confusion happened neroes day plot thus layd match set appointed doe feat waited time aforesaid suddainely counsell turned mild commaundement given put wicked act unto second consultation whole engine forging calumniation turned upon iulian newly brought thither renowmed prince afterwards intangled within twofold crime iniquitie unjustice men deemed first marcellifundus place lying cappadocia flitted asia upon desire learne liberall science againe hee seene ga u brother hee passed constantinople cleared himselfe imputation shewed done neither two thing without warrant yet urgent suit cursed crew flatterer died gracious favour heavenly power eusebia empresse queene stood friend whose meanes brought towne como comum neere millain abode little permitted travaile greece according ardent desire studie apply wit learning neither wanted henceforth matter arising case punished order law would displeased good fortunat issue else fell away without effect void vaine happened sometimes rich seeking succour greater mightier men hand cleaving close unto yvie doth tall tree bought discharge deliverie exceeding high rate whereas poorer sort small meanes none defend life condemned downeright without order therefore truth disguised masked lie diver time also false forged matter went currant true time gorgonius also brought question charge caesar bedchamber committed unto appeared upon confession hee beene partie enterprise designes yea otherwhiles setter causer yet complotting practising guelded eunuch while justice shadowed lie finely framed wound himselfe danger went wayes cleare chap taken part gallus together many innocent person cruelly punished taking cup liberally blurted foolish word constantius therefore put dolorous torment kept close prison while matter thus passe millaine brought aquileia east martiall men whole troupe company together number belonging gallus aforotime courtier limmes readie fall sunder among rhinwalder scudo lepontij runneth downefals water manner nilus swift current swelling immediately first head beginneth store owne water violently passeth forward one single channell time augmented mile stadium breadth well neere much whereto accesse land thicke growne shadie unpleasant wood unlesse auncient sober valour roman made broad way while nature ground rigour also ayre impeached barbarian mere therfore river frothing whirlepooles breaking running still standing water thereof cutteth quite middest betweene two equall side throughout end like unto element severed apart everlasting discord without encreasing diminishing one whit streame carried saving name strength whole maketh end race neither afterwards suffereth meeting fellowship river entreth himselfe gulfe maine ocean great wonder neither lake stirred violent streame running yet river stayed hastie course muddie filth lake howsoever confounded together yet mixed one bodie sight prove man would beleeve meanes could parted one thus alpheus orphea rophea rising arcadia love beareth fountaine arethusa cutting quite ionian sea runneth forward fable doe report confines beloved arbetio expecting untill messenger came bring word barbarian comming although knew beginning warres usually sharpe fell within danger privie ambush suddaine unlooked mischiefe strucken stone dead meane enemy discovered romanes fortification while morning mist dimmed light ran downe braving drawne sword grating teeth letting flye big prowd menace suddaine scutarij targuetiers sallied forth reason troupe enemy good policie state wote said kinsman ought bee preferred much debating matter way deliberation fro resolution stood firme setting aside frivolous bootlesse disputation hee fully determined take unto iulianus compartener imperiall governement sent come day prefixed emperour company fellow souldiors present called together tribunall erected upon high banke stood maine standerds eagle ensignes mounted unto holding iulianus right hand thus way mild gentle speech began say stand right valorous defendors weale publique maintaine manner one breath spirit common cause plead equall iudges encouraged upon confidence assured persuasion extreame necessity bind u fast ynough occasion land farre disioyned asunder mischiefe therefore incrocheth alreadie beyond frontier hard adioyning time permitteth helpe together consultation shall ioyntly one accord meet neckes prowd nation swell big bound also empire shall remaine entire resteth hope affaire doe conceive yee also strengthen fortunate effect iulianus mine unckles sonne father side well approoved yee know well ynough modestie regard whereof well neerenesse bloud deare unto u young gentleman industrious action alreadie appeareth wish ioyne place power caesar motion mine thinke profitable expedient confirmed also graunt allowance say effect assembly interrupting speech gentle manner stayed saying foreknowledge future consequence choice mightie iupiter man wit understanding emperour standing still without stirring untill silent went confidently rest speech much quoth ioyfull acclamation sheweth correspondencie favourable assent let young gentleman endued peaceable vigour whose temperate behaviour imitated rather commended rise honour seconded fortunate favour whose singular towardnesse instructed good art even herein thinkes fully shewed chosen therefore grace present direction heavenly god clad princely robe said soone put upon iulian grandfather purple declared caesar joy armie speaketh unto somewhat sad carrying demisle lowly looke manner thou hast thy prime brother mine loving brother ever recovered glorious flower thy parentage originall augmented confesse mine owne glorie take selfe truly advaunced conferring superiour power upon noble prince mine owne bloud soveraigne power selfe enioy come therefore partaker paine peril undertake defence service gaule one readie bountifulnesse ease part afflicted need require ioyne battaile enemy stand sure footing among ensignebearers considerate exhorter encourager adventure due time leading way advised warinesse heartening emboldening fight succour supply strengthening troubled disarray modest tearms rebaking slouthfull present true witnesse well industrious souldior idle coward therefore urgent service requireth forth like valiant knight lead likewise hardie souldiors assistant one another turnes course firme stedfast love serve together another day god graunt request ioyntly governe world equall moderation pietie part shall place even present againe whatsoever shall goe bee wanting hasten sake unto highest enterprise men wish prayer ioyne purposing defend vigilant care station ward assigned unto commonwealth selfe word ended man afterward held peace souldiors terrible clattering knocked shield knee together full signe prosperitie contentment contrariwise smite shield speares token anger dolour wonder see great joy except approoved judgement election emperour worthie admiration entertained caesar glittering resplendent imperiall robe whose eye carrying terrour amiable lovelinesse withall whose pleasing countenance also extraordinarie quicknesse lively vigour wistly long time beheld gathered one like prove throughly perused old bookes reading whereof declareth bodily signes physiognomie inward indewments mind end might regarded better respect reverence neither commended measure yet lesse meet becomming therefore esteemed voice censours souldiors end taken sit chariot received regall palace serve compendious way commodious travailers standing midst betwixt old alpes touching report anone learned knowne cottian alpes begin town regusio susa leandro segusio peaketh mightie high mount man almost penetrabile passe without danger men come gaule bendeth steepe forward great downefall terrible behold reason cliffes hanging either side especially spring time frost yce thaweth snow melteth hot breath wind streits broken side hole ditch hidden heapes frozen yce men verily staggering staying foot make shift come downe horse cart fall headlong forward put mischiefe one remedie alone hath beene devised namely wagon mightie great rope tied fast unto maine strength men ox straining behind stay scarcely creeping pace somewhat safely come rolling downe said happeneth spring time yeare winter ground charged coat yce smoothed therewith thereby slipperie foot setteth men forward gate run upon nose open vallies along broad wide plaines trusted reason yce beare swallow otherwhiles folke passing thereupon regard danger cunning way know countrey well pitch downe fast certaine pile maine stake timber bearing head ground way along safer place end way faring man directed stand row may passe without harme happen lye hidden hilled snow namely overthrowne land flouds river falling downe mountaines hardly passable guidance rusticall people leading way pitch italian cliffe reacheth plaine space seven myles unto station named marti hence another high hill upright much adoe passed stretcheth forward farre head top matrona occasion name came chaunce befell unto noble woman whence way verily lyeth steepe downe yet easie travaileable farre fort brigantium standeth towne brianson virgantia sepulchre said pettie king reported made way abovenamed segusio neere unto wals mane concerning borne armenia free parentage taken prisoner enemy borderer even while little one carried away sold unto couple romane marchants brought palace constantine little little skilfull training good government gave sufficient proofe honest course carriage life also wit knowledge instructed literature much might suffice one state calling passing quick conceit devising inventing doubtfull scrupulous question exceeded also excellent memorie desirous doe good full righteous counsell constantius emperour would haue regarded time past growth youthfull yeares might heard one maturitie stayed ripenesse giving many precept lesson tending honestie justice sinned leastwise committed veniall trespass eutherius praposituscubicul principall chamberlaine would seeme reforme even iulian also nuzzled engraffed manner asia therefore vaine unconstant moreover retyred himselfe aside quiet life afterwards taken eftsoones palace sober behaviour alwaies passing well stayed two notable singular vertues faithfulnesse continence embraced challenged time rest beene either disclosed secret unlesse save another man life burnt greedie desire getting whence came passe withdrawing himselfe anone rome setled resiant untill well stept yeares carrying good conscience keepe companie esteemed hee loved degree whereas kind person wont commonly gotten rich unjust indirect meanes seeke secret corner flyer light shunning sight multitude whome wronged guelded eunuch old time compare eutherius perusing many time monument antiquitie could never find long since auncestors day though trustie profitable lord yet stained spotted certaine vice speciall good quality one gotten studious endevour naturall wit either given greedie extortion overfiercely felly bent hotely set upon mischiefe kind pleasing loved else excessive prowd overweening greatnesse one eunuch every way skilfull well qualified confesse never read heard notwithstanding presumed upon sufficient testimonie age happily curious reader antiquity set opposition u menophilus eunuch mithridates king pontus let upon advertisement call remembrance nothing hath beene recorded onely gloriously shewed utmost extremitie chap iiii example tragoedies acted constantius theatre confident fortunate libertie vrsulus honourable person used defence truth stupiditie constantius maketh way civile trouble calamity whereof example laid open worth observation let returne whence digressed marcellus said taken foile serdica place nativitie destroyed within emperours court militarie tearmes allegorically taken campe many horrible act pretence maintaining imperiall majestie committed one sought counsell unto cunning men wisards squeaking rat meeting weazill way praesaging signe hee used old woman charme enchantment mitigate paine thing warrant physicke may avowed partie hereof enformed meanes could guesse therupon hast endited arraigned suffered death time report went certain man named danu wife onely upon feare terror accused slight matter guiltie indeed unguiltie whether hee list avouch want defence hee rufinus insulted beguiled gave information particular knew gaudentius pursivant intelligencer africanus consularem consulare governour pannonia given notice principall office belonging praefectus praetorio while also greatly suspect place corrupt defective untill therfore perfect copie may foud must passe manner hee chiefe actor way vow earnest promise twice speech went induced brought wavering fickle minded woman hee filthily lyen danger selfe hurt persuaded packing number lye together accuse guiltlesse husband treason namely forge thus much stollen purple garment covering dioclesians sepulchre privitie hidden thus framed matter utter destruction many rufinus himselfe hope greater booty hies apace emperours campe raise false slaunders wonted manner knowledge taken thing commaundement given mavortius praefectus prator lord chiefe iustice emperour man high resolution streight inquisition looke throughly crime joyned commission heare case vrsulus high treasurer emperour man likewise commendable severitie matter therefore aggravated according condition good liking time nothing upon torture great many could found iudges fault seeke length truth beene overmuch oppressed smoothered breathed againe upon point necessitie woman confesseth rufinus author machination neither suppressed shee filthie adulterie committed howsoever presently contempt lawes much debate canvasing fro yet length order justice sentence condemnation given dye constantius intelligence hereof fared fumed lamenting also protector defendor life perished sent horseman post commaunded th reatening manner vrsulus returne unto counsell verily rejecting would stayed brake fearelesse entred consistorie free speech bold heart declared beene done thus stoutly stopped mouthes flatterer word say delivered prefect iustice abovesaid himselfe great danger happened aquitaine fame bruited farther abroad certaine craftie cousener invited sumptuous feast whereof many country seeing paire fine toralium table cloth linnen counterpoint two button exceeding neither passage sound large skill servitor might meet close together table spred like naperie carrying hand forepart cloke whole furniture within clothes adorned set together principall thing rich patrimonie assure evertit everrit swoopt away like malicious naughtinesse certaine pursivant intelligencer employed spaine bidden semblably supper heard boyes bringing light evening crie manner vincamus let u winne making wicked hainous interpretation thereof brought ruine destroyed noble house like prankes played every day constantius beeing exceeding timorous feared alwaies marke shot even denis tyrant sicilie upon selfesame infirmitie taught even owne daughter play barber would commit face stranger shaven made smooth little house rowme wont lie environed deep ditch made drawbridge might unjointed taken asunder every peece disjoined plank pinnes whereof carried went bed set together againe joynts goe forth morning betimes trumpet sounded alarme civile trouble great men likewise emperours house gave blast end might beg good condemned person unite owne appeared manifest proofes constantine first opened iawes favourite constantius fed fat marrow province emperour head principal every state degree infinitely enflamed greedie desire rich without respective difference justice right among ordinarie exercise clvile jurisdiction iudges first rufinus prafectus pratorio lord chiefe iustice among militarie people cattell sometimes gained comming upon suddaine otherwhiles overmatched multitude souldiors lost also permitted sight might carried away howbeit musonianus prafectus prat rio lord chiefe iustice part furnished said many good art yet corrupt man given briberie money easie turned truth mean certaine spy suborned sent purpose cunning artisan deceiving jugling enquired project plot persian joyning consultation cassianus duce lord g warden march mesopotamia warrior hardened sundry service daungerous exploit notwithstanding plaine intelligence giuen unto faithfull relation said spy agreeing one talke king sapor utmost march kingdome much slaughter bloud shed people could hardly repell nation infested dominion yet meanes base obscure souldiers secret conference hand ducem marquesse lord warden sapor lay neere unto province oportunity might serve would letter advise king make firme peace length romane emperor whereby secured every side might tame subdue enemy continually molested sapor saide dux marque warden condescended hereunto gotten thus much trusting thereupon enformeth king constantius much encumbred grieuous warres way entreaty required haue peace while letter sent unto chionites halani whose confines king sapor wintered long time passed betweene chap v constantius cowardly prince thinketh upon triumph mightie long traine largely described great pompe entreth rome while matter disposing thus according time required well part gaule constantius hauing made peace whole world shut temple ianus vanquished enemy desirous see rome triumph without glorious matter name magnentius overthrowe death even romane bloud neither vanquished himselfe nation made warre understood conquered valour owne captaines laid aught unto empire ne yet seene extremitie daungers either formost among formost forsooth might shew goodly pompe reaching mighty length banner stiffe againe goldsmith worke beautifull traine gard unto people liuing much tranquillitie neither hoping wishing ever see like sight againe knew peradventure auncient prince time peace verily contented themselues attendance serjeant officer heat battailes could abide slacknesse one e lanter hast haue committed himselfe forward gale wind fisher boate another example decij given away life commonwealth another againe owne person among meanest souldiers viewed enemy euery man according desert second sec praef ct lo iust ce praefectship orphitus passed ocriculum lifted high great honour environed also garded traine admirable troupe conducted battaile aray men eye became wholy fixed bent beholding sight approched citie beheld gracious countenance senatours according place giving attendance dutifull wise reverend presence noble patrician thought cyneas embassadour pyrrhus number king assembled together temple sanctuarie world place hee turned himselfe toward common people wondered exceedingly quickly men world thus conflowed rome hee beene terrifie euphrates rhene shew armour ensignes went side himselfe mounted alone upon chariot gold glittering againe bright precious stone sundrie sort whose shining seemed certaine mingled light manifold degree alternative course high power authoritie while others againe compassed dragon wrought woufe purple thred fastened top speares gold set costly gem gaping blowing wide mouth therefore hissing angry therewith leaving winding tailes wift wind side marched double ranke armed men targuets crested helmet sending ray beames brandishing light wearing upon fine shirt maile habergeon men armes entermingled bard horse persian use call clibanarij harnessed good corselet bard guard steele one would taken image finely polished handworke praxiteles men indeed also went thin plated hoopes made fit handsome bending body running limmes way soever need stirre moove joynts apparrell habiliment would agree thereto joyning thereof meet served well every way therefore saluted luckie acclamation name augustus while noyse voice trumpet together thundered broken sound trembled againe shewing himselfe sort unmooveable hee wont bee seene owne province bowed downe bodie low entred high gate also stiffe necke head beene one piece armed casting eye directly turned face neither right hand left beene image man neither seene much give nod head wheele shogged spit wipe lip blow rub nose wag hand round ineffable mortall men reached attempted againe without hope therefore endevour attempt thing onely horse traian standing middest court yard emperour himselfe portraied sitting said would also could imitate whereat hormisda prince persia persian courtier bloud royall standing hard whose departure persis declared shaped answere manner countrey gesture commaund emperour quoth like stable built thou able horse thou art disposed make may come take large rowme doth wee behold potentate beeing asked thought rome said tooke contentment onely hee learned even also men mortall emperour therefore seene many thing strucke dreadfull astonishment complained fame either small force else maliciously disposed using alwayes make every thing yet blasing abroad monument rome fayleth strength diligence used issue valiant man might come light grow good proofe well emperour willing desirous make long abode seat others full majestie end might thereby enjoy pure repose pleasure terrified continuall newes reported certaine gave understand suevians made roades rhaetiae quadi also invaded part pannonia valeria yea tartarians sarmatians people expert theeving robberie wasted upper maesia second part hungarie pannonia moldavia wherewith much mooved upon thirtieth day entred rome wit may fourth calends iune tooke journey citie hastened way per tridentum trent illyricum whence place marcellus sent severus experienced warriour long continuance grounded commaunded vrsicinus repaire unto hee received letter gladly came sirmisch ortel sirmium accompanied fellowes long pondering consulting peace musonianus related might established persian sent backe againe east authoritie magisterij generall cavallerie elder sort companie provectis forte profectis advaunced conduct rule souldiors younger men commaundement attend upon person readie performe whatsoever commaund behalfe commonwealth chap vii iulian passed winter senones invadeth alemanes raging wonted manner passeth rhene foord many foiles overthrowes weakened forceth retyre island rhene part bvt caesar passed troublesome winter senones yeare emperour ninth time consull himselfe second occasion germanie menace thundered every side remooved fortunate houre good presaging token made hast rhemes cheerefull joyous government armie committed severus man neither given discord yet arrogant approoved frugalitie long time knowne warfare souldiors readie follow directly going leader also himselfe guided commission another part barbatio death silvanus preferred bee colonell infanterie commaundement emperour power five twentie thousand armed men came rauraci devised carefully ordered beforehand alemanes raged wonted manner raunged abroad redoubled power force marshalled manner paire tongs beeing driven strait beaten downe hewed piece howbeit while project well thought digested good order hastening forward execution barbarian right joyous cunning take time steale rob passed secret wise betweene army lay encamped assaulted lyon lugdunum unawares sacking thereof greedie endevour burnt quite blocking avenue driven backe made havocke whatsoever could found without towne damage losse sooner knowne caesar sent three cornet light armed right valiant horseman observed three way knowing without doubt robber would breake away escape neither failed effecting projected went way cut whole pillage recovered untouched onely escaped cleare without harme passed securitie fence fort barbatio lay suffered slip away bainobaudes tribune valentinian emperour afterwards troupe horseman regiment ordained dearest friend together corne barbarous richesse unto place remote chap viii fort named trestabernae reedifieth chonodomarius vestralpus aleman king put flight barbatio colonell romane footman chased part armie puissant army sat downe neere unto argentoratum embassadours insult iulianus caesar turning hence reedifying trestabernae fort called long since obstinate assault enemy destroyed rebuilt sure german might kept entring inland part gaule wont finished worke sooner looked laid one whole yeare bee placed defend place food sufficient beene gathered together souldiors hand without feare danger even barbarian harvest verily content herewith onely hee purveyed also himselfe victual serve twentie dayes warrior willingly made use gotten owne right hand taking great snuffe indignation could nothing provision corne newly brought unto barbatio passed hard prowdly caught hand residue remained behind layed upon heape burnt every jot whether like vaine braineficke foole boldly enterprised many wicked attempt commaundement emperour knowne howbeit bruited abroad place rife every man mouth iulian chosen caesar give easement distressed state gaule hee might cruell warres come end thought freshwater souldior one could endure much clattering noyse armour well while worke sayd fort goeth apace forward while part souldiors maketh forefences abroad field others againe gather corne warily feare ambushments barbarous multitude preventing exceeding celeritie rumour comming violently suddaine set upon barbatio armie hee conduct hath beene said divided severed gaulish fortification following chase farre rauraci yea long could carried away greatest part carriage labouring beast campe slave returned home againe hee performed notable fortunate expedition bestowed souldiors wintering harbour returned emperours court minding frame action accusation caesar manner readie time bitterly assayle vexe foule foyle terrour dispersed spread abroad aleman king chonodomarius vestralpus vrius also vrsicinus together secapio suomarius hortarius assembling force power together one place sat downe neere unto argentoratum supposing caesar retyred feare utter extremitie whereas continued still busily employed finishing fort abovesaid made bolder beare head confidently certaine false fugitive one band scutarij scutarius fearing punishment crime committed fled unto departure captaine put flight declared remained fifteene thousand armed men iulianus number indeed followed while fierce cruell barbarian every side set upon rage furious fight vpon whose constant avouching still tale pricked boldnesse dare greater matter sending embassadours away imperiously ynough commaunded caesar depart landes conquered valour sword point chap ix while enemy thus proudly brave iulianus politiquely looking himselfe exhorteth armie fight souldiors captaines force cheerefully approove counsell generall commaunder caesar could skill cowardly feare neither driven fit anger stricken downe griefe sorrow laughing vaine presumption barbarian kept embassador untill worke fortification fully ended persisted still degree resolution stirred foot moreover king chonodomarius bearing himselfe big every place chiefe setter dangerous enterprise kept great stirre made trouble confusion beyond measure lifting browes aloft prowd looke one highly conceited regard fortunate successe many time affaire onely plaine pitched field encountred decentius caesar gave overthrow also rased sacked many wealthie city yea long time invaded overran gaule pleasure while none gainesay withstand confirmed yet confident boldnesse fresh discomfiture flight great barbatio leader number puissance od alemans beholding badge armes shield knew souldiors let brigand robber enjoy land feare whome sundry time buckled close flight losse many went away dispersed disarray whereat caesar pensive tooke matter grievously upon urgent necessitie driving thereto escaped daungers enforced though valorous men affront encounter populous nation bright sunne beames began appeare trumpet sound footman led foorth marching faire softly troupe light horseman flanked side wing betweene bestowed cataphracti complete harneis armed piece corselettiers archer dreadfull kind armed souldiors much place whence romanes advaunced standerds unto barbarian fort foureteene league say one twentie myles caesar good regard well vantage securitie called backe forerunner pricked forth silence proclaimed usuall oyes unto souldiors standing band company made according naturall disposition mild speech regard maintaining common safetie urgeth caesar speake sparily man base abiect mind exhort beseech fellow souldiers presuming doe upon well growne stout valour chuse rather warie way either endure put backe peril feared overhastie doubtfull dangerous adventure meet forwardnesse manhood boldnesse occasion require ought regible advised considerat mine opinion therefore iudgement shall accord thereto iust indignation endure briefe declare day groweth well noonetide tyred wearied tedious iourney shall welcommed stonie blind way night wane old moone like helpe shining starres land u burnt heat comfort succour water man make good effect may well ease passe whole troupe enemy rest refection meat drinke come rushing violently upon u vigour seeing body enfeebled hunger thirst travaile make resistance much therefore difficult business dispose order thought upon time hath oftentimes affoorded remedie right counsell given hath beene taken good part divine meanes even heaven sometimes recovered set upright tottering estate men affaire beseech let u empaled within rampire trench take rest dividing watch turnes time enioyed benefit sleepe food convenient advaunce forward leave god spoken breake day triumphant standard victorious ensignes souldiers could well endure untill end speech gnashing grinding teeth shewing hot desire fight knocking sheilds speares together besought earnestly might led foorth give enemie battaile within sight trusting upon favour god heaven confident also presuming upon approoved vertues fortunate leader director end shewed certaine comfortable angell genius place readie long present excited fight helpe forward alacritie cheerefulnesse full assent also great captaines high officer especially florentius praefecti praetorio praefect praetorium one accord agreed great reason side fight though much danger while barbarous enemy preassed plumpes heapes turne aside way hee said stirres souldiors given much upon bred heat seditious commotion would bee intollerable could hardly endure without attempt extreame course victorie thought wrested hand furthermore twofold consideration encouraged emboldened men calling remembrance yeare last past romanes raunged pleasure country beyond rhene seene man defend dwelling house make resistance lane wayes every side stopped lopping cutting downe tree lying thicke together nipping cold mid winter barbarian thus remooved farre much adoe live also vpon emperours entrie land daring eyther resist shew head upon humble request entreatie obtained peace man considered case time altered combred kept downe threefold mischiefe namely emperour lay sore upon rhaetia caesar hard permitted escape next borderer civile discord caused enemy readie manner tread upon neck behind thus hemmed every side afterwards upon graunt peace emperour departed neighbor nation matter cause brawles allayed reconciled growne agreement withall dishonourable departure barbatio romane leader much encreased pride stoutnesse naturally bred likewise went worse romanes part another meanes upon occasion occurrent two brother bloud royall fast tied vertue peace obtained constantius durst neither raise uprore much stirre within one named gundomadus greater person twaine firme word traine murthered people conspired banded enemy presently withall common sort also vandomarius subject affirmed joyned force regiment barbarian made warre well armie highest lowest gave allowance even convenient meet time joyne battaile slacked nothing resolute mind fully bent fight suddaine standardbearer cried tearmes foorth happie fortunate caesar whither kind favour fortune leadeth thee thee length sence valour militarie policie advaunce forward lead way luckie valiant warrior marching vaward hard standard good proofe thou shalt souldiors sight warlike leader individui inseparable witnesse service performed able upon motif encouragement case may please god heaven assist chap x order alemans armie principall commaunders thereof iulianus second time wisely encourageth well ownemen stranger give battaile heard without respite delay whole armie marched approched hill pretie height easie ascent spred standing corne ripe readie harvest farre distant edge bankes rhene top whereof three horseman enemy lying espiall rose readie give notice suddainely romane hoast neere hand made hast companie one footman able follow taken quicke pursute men told u germanes three dayes three night together passed river leader espied hard arraunging thicke close together squadron made stand stirred foot while maine battaile antepilani pikemen hastati formost every ranke vaward stood firme fast like strong insoluble wall semblable warinesse enemy kept ground made hast forward according foresaid fugitive told saw cavallerie right side opposite unto flower horseman bestowed thicke thronged together left wing among entermingled skirmisher footman lightly appointed well wist horseman though skilfull souldior otherwise fighting man armes complete harneis while holdeth shield reines bridle shaking casting speare one hand doe hurt unto warriour hidden wholly yron armour proofe footman point height danger man wont take heed aught commeth way encountereth creepeth close ground digging horse side able throw rider horse head ere aware may small adoe killed marshalled matter thus right side battaile flanked made sure secret blind ambushments chiefe leader warlike fierce nation chonodomarius serapio higher place power authoritie king chonodomarius verily mischievous firebrand whole warre flamecolour wreath tassell fitted crest advaunced led left wing man bold trusting upon wonderfull strength bone brawne heat battaile looked mounted high upon lustie frothing courser bearing great breadth bignesse bulke launce rest terrible bignesse bravely seene glittering armor hardie souldior aforetime also good leader others right side conducted serapio even lustie gallant tender downe growing cheekes action forward yeares sonne chonodomarius brother medericus perfidious wretch life time called father kept hostage pledge long time gaule learned certaine hidden greeke mystery changed name sonne originally first cleped agenarichus serapio followed king potentate next power unto number five prince bloud royall tenne also great traine ranke noble five thirtie thousand fighting men armed levied sundry nation partly wage partly upon covenant agreement like service tendered unto againe time terribly sounded trumpers alarme severus romane leader commaund left wing drew neere unto trench said full armed men whence order beene given afore lying close hidden start suddaine breake array stood still without feare somwhat suspitious blind ambushments hee attempted neither recule backe step forward caesar saw courageous enter upon service greatest danger guarded troupe two hundred horse according heat service required riding swiftly among footman stood embattailed gave comfortable word encouragement considering speake unto neither large ground tooke stretched foorth length number great multitude assembled would permit otherwise avoided heavie load envie displeasure feare might thought affect emperour supposed due himselfe alone taking good heed unto himselfe riding apace without shot enemy like speech animated souldiors knowne unknowne one another play men doe devoire valiantly quoth come full time fighting good friend companion long since wished heretofore yee required calling armes unquiet mutinous manner likewise hee come others behind post signan ensignes placed rereward behold saith fellow souldiors long hoped day compelleth u wash away former staines blot received recover unto maiestie romane empire owne due honour barbarian excessive furie rage utter overthrow destruction whole estate hath forced come way puissance foiled troden foot semblably others well experienced long practise warre arraunged better order encouraged like exhortation let u rouse bestirre self right hardie knight let u put away fortitude fit shamefull reproches fastened upon associate beheld much doubting delaymaking though yeelded take upon name caesar whomsoever hee perceived inconsiderately call signall battaile unruly stirres like breake commaundement beseech saith doe marre glory future victorie following overgreedily enemy yee put flight give ground yeeld extreame necessitie shall bee flye doubtlesse forsake wound enemy backes present without difference even one case may done moderate warie advisement chap xi bloudie battaile fought betweene alemans romanes wherein wisdome valour invincible courage iulian especially appeareth often iterated like word manner opposed greater part armie full forefront barbarian suddainely heard noyse aleman footman mixt indignation cry one accord voice prince bloud royall leaving horse ought converse keepe companie feare ought happen well would leave miserable common souldiors make shift easily bee gone field beeing knowne chonodomarius quickly alighted beast foot rest following example without delay one made doubt side win day signall therefore battaile sound trumpet solemnely given encountred one another great violence dart arrowes discharged seene flying aire german running hast good speed drawing weapon right hand hideous gnashing teeth flew upon troups horseman fared raged wonted manner long shag haire made terrible sight eye certaine furie sparkled foorth whome romane resolute souldiors covering head putting shield betweene holding sword brandishing dart threatening death greatly terrified while point medley side horseman strongly entrouped footman stoutly fortified owne side making front joyning buckler close fast together raised cloud thicke dust much running traversing ground betweene diver way while men one made head another gave ground barbarian skilfull warriours striving oppose set knee forward laboured hard repell enemie exceeding resolution side presently came handie stroke buckler pykes thrust one another skie rang againe lowd voyces well shouted feld readie die left wing advauncing forward still full pace maine force driven many band company germanes preasing hard upon great noise angrie mood charged upon barbarian horseman kept right wing great disarray beyond expectation left battaile while formost fled hindered hindmost soone within protection legion bosome stayed renewed fight againe fortuned upon occasion while broken rankes file setting againe order men armes complete harneis seeing captaine lightly wounded one consort killed weightie armour horse fallen upon necke slipped way made shift every man hee could treading footman put rout close thronged together bearing one upon another stood ground sure mooved caesar therefore perceived farre horseman looked nothing might make meanes escape flight gallopped horse toward like barre way restrained taken knowledge purple ensigne dragon fitted top high launce beene pendant slough serpent certaine tribune one troupe stood still strucken feare looking pale upon matter rode backe againe renew battaile men love doe doubtfull case caesar mild manner rebuking whither goe wee backe quoth valiant souldiors know yee flight never found safetie bewrayeth folly vaine attempt returne companie partaker leastwise hereafter glorie ever forsake inconsiderately while fighting commonwealth word spake good respect brought backe againe undergoe office warfare followed herein example old sylla brought forth force field archelaus captaine mithridates hote battaile wearied forsaken souldiors ran formost ranke vauntguard caught banner flung side enemy goe way said chosen fellowes danger many shall aske generall left answere thus faile left alone boeotia fighting u spending owne bloud chap xii sharpe conflict footman fighting close hand stroke variable fortune length alemans put flight defeated suffer afearefull overthrow alemans therefore discomfited disbanded horseman charged upon foreward front footman minding casting away mind purpose resisting make head first cause recule come cope handstrokes fight maintained long time equall tearmes cornuti braccati redoubted souldiors long experience warres manfully received point set mightie great shout called barritus outcrie heat medley beginning small humming growing bigger little little riseth higher manner wave beating rockes arrowes dart flew thicke fro singing noise flew dust arose equall stirring side tooke away eyesight caused run armour body one upon another barbarian without order violence anger burnt like flaming fire close jointed shieldfence defended men manner roufe hacked hewed many stroke sword knowne batavi together king puissant terrible troupe ran speed helpe fellowes readie rescue deliver assistance fortune extremitie compassed round alemans began fiercely fight puffed blowed hard furious fit would utterly destroyed stood way yet gave javelines castingdarts yea yron headed arrowes let flye although close fight also one weapon strucke upon another habergeon cloven sword wounded bloud shed rose againe doe service died sort even matched alemans strong taller souldiors long experience practise cunning fierce fell turbulent quiet warie romanes bold heart courageous presuming upon mightie big body howbeit otherwhiles romane weight armour driven back rose barbarian knee wearied stepping pressing forward bowing left ham backe would ease himselfe lye close behind readie yet give assault upon enemie token obstinacie stiffe resolution highest degree leapt foorth suddainely gallant troupe noble among king also fought common sort following brake within battaillons vantguard men making way came farre legion primani main battaile placed middest guard strength use call castra praetoria souldiors thicker arranged many rankes file therefore manner tower standing ground firme fast greater courage fell fight againe carrying heedfull eye ward venies covering close manner swordfencer drawne sword ran enemy side reason hote furious anger lay open barbarian againe fully bent spend life gaine victorie assayed leuse battaile jointly knit together seeing number lying dead rewes way romanes upon taking better heart unto layed along followed many meane remained alive place slaine heard many grone lay dying place exceeding feare stricken astonied outwearied last much painefull toile strength served thenceforth onely flye diver sundry lane made shift speed could get away much like unto mariner make hast middest surging wave boisterous tempest sea cast upon land way soever wind carrieth romanes upon victorie thing rather wished hoped man confesse present worship gracious power god propice mercifull unto howbeit souldiors without mercie slashing hewing upon backes fled otherwhiles reason sword bent rebated wherewith strike longer thrust barbarian heart owne weapon neither one wounding satisfied anger bloudshed thought right hand ynough yet slaughter humble entreatie supplication would take pitie give execution thus therefore lay mightie number thrust bodie death craving none remedie quickly bee dispatched life halfe dead breath began faile sought yet dying heavie eye meanes live longer others head cut manner quite huge weapon hung downe hold throat number mierie slipperie ground chauncing slide fall downe bloud fellowes although weapon touched body overwhelmed souldiors rushing running heapes killed winner got good hand enemy yet preassed still forcibly point edge weapon waxed blunt dull striking thicke bright helmet shield together lay tumbled foot barbarian last seeing driven utmost extremitie heapes dead carcass rose high stopped passage sought onely helpe remained even river ran hard backes souldiors running great pace even armour wearie preassed still upon fled supposing skilfull swimming bee able rid danger committed life unto wave river regard caesar together tribune captaines quicke forecast foreseeing danger might ensue cryed rebuking manner gave streight charge one men hote pursute enemie venture upon streame full whirlepits whereupon order tooke standing upon bankes river sundry sort dart castingweapons sticked germanes one happened swift nimblenesse get away deadly dint shot weight bodie thus plunged sunke downe bottome river like certaine theatricall spectacle hanging make shew strange wonder man might without feare seene many sight could skill swimming sticke close take hold good stout swimmer others float aloft like log wood spent strength became faint sort wound within wave devoured violence streame striving againe carried upon shield declining crooked turning aside high surge mightie billowes readie come full upon many perill passed floundered heeles soft clammie mud got length streightway fat corpulent heavie man though recovered succour pretie hill hard known could bee concealed hee greatnesse former estate bewrayed element loosening joynts encounter run one upon another owne accord fall backe ground doth settle necessitie crashing noyse rumbling earth within must bellow rore like bull proceed wee hence historie begun chap viii iulianus while maketh abode paris warreth upon alemans franci salij chamani defeated subdued fell famine armie caused tumult hot mutinie quenched souldiors passe rhene lay wast alemans territory bvt caesar while wintered paris hastened diligence possible prevent alemans yet assembled together battaile argentoratum become audacious cruell beyond measure waiting still moneth iuly whence gaule use begin warreservice come field much troubled long time mind go forth could corne brought acquitaine upon breaking cold weather frost reason mild summer season diligent considerate regard conqueresse manner difficulty casting many sundry thing head way found namely without expecting full season yeare encounter barbarian looked setled resolution tooke corne twentie day store provided spent standing place abode baked throughly last bisket bread commonly call buccellatum layed upon willing souldiors shoulder confident helpe good houre hee tooke journey thinking within five sixe moneths two urgent necessarie expedition might performed thing put readinesse first others marcheth frankes meane commonly tearmed salij old time durst romane ground place called weser toxiandria boldly place plant hee come tongeren tungri embassage foresaid people meeteth supposing emperour found still wintering harbour pretending peace upon condition man might eyther provoke molest while remained quiet owne territory embassadours hee fully digested disposed affaire opposed certaine ambiguous doubtfull condition meant stay tract untill returne sent away rewarded sooner way homeward followed hard upon sending generall severus suddainely set upon along rivage smote beene whitling thunderbolt flash lightening fell entreatie rather make resistance turning effect victorie commodious course clemencie upon yeelding rich child tooke mercie chamavi likewise given semblable attempt set upon celeritie partly put sword partly stoutly resisted taken alive hung yrons upon others tooke heeles fearefully hast fled permitted get away without hurt unto whose embassadours sent afterward make supplication provide estate lying humbly prostrate upon ground face eye graunted peace capitulation returne safetie owne home thus thing succeeded according heart desire hastening vigilant care found mean possible good province thought time would permit repaire three skonces fort situate directly rew upon banke river mosa lately beene overthrowne obstinate selfewilled barbarian forthwith omitting warres small time reedified end policie wisely begun might quicke dispatch make safe seventeene day provision corne souldiors marched forward expedition carried neckes defalked portion layed hold hoping much taken might bee supplied chamavians corne field fell farre otherwise reason standing corne yet ripe souldiors spent carried finding food place fell threatening tearmes highest degree provoked iulian foule name opprobrious language calling vaine grecian asia deceitfull yea one shew wisedome learning lob foole usually found even among armed souldiors readie rolling tongue owne fellowes stucke mumble many like speech whither drawne without hope better time past verily endured hard travaile irkesome abidden even snowes pinching cold bitter frost shamefull indignitie upon point finally vanquish defeat enemy readie pine away consume famine inglorious base kind death man may thinke u mutineus given raise commotion protest life onely speake craving neither gold silver long agoe might much see denied u convicted undertaken many toilefull paine peril even state commonweale say truth good reason thus complaine among many course probable allowable matter doubtfull point necessitie souldiors outtoyled spent painefull service gaule gotten neither e donative wage since time iulian thither sent neither himselfe could come aught give constantius wonted manner permitted allowance bestowed hence appeared plainely done upon fraudulent malice rather nigardize said caesar given small matter value certaine common souldior asking somewhat according need goe unto barber trimmed contumelious tearmes traduced backbitten gaudentius notarie abode long gaule spie proceeding afterwards himselfe commaunded put death shall shewed place convenient length mutinie appeased without sundrie sort faire word pleasing speech meanes bridge made ship joyned together passed rhene set foot alemans country severus generall horseman aforetime beene warlike industrious captaine suddaine became lither heartlesse oftentimes encouraged fight courageously seemed contemptible timorous dissuader battaile haply feare death neere hand like read bookes tages tuscane within smitten lightening veiovis f dulled sences heare neither thunder great noise whatsoever contrarie wonted manner hee marched journey lazily insomuch hee terrified threatening death guide led way apace lustily unlesse one accord would agree avouch altogether ignorant way fearing authoritie prohibition went one foot forward chap ix aleman king suomarius hortarius able endure heavie weight warre humble manner sue peace obtaine howbeit lingering delayes suomarius king alemans owne accord together friend follower unthought met caesar upon way prince time prowd cruelly bent endammage hurt romanes thought would unexpected gaine well gotten case might suffered hold owne countenance gate shewed humble suppliant entertained willed good cheare quiet mind abandoning wholly owne pleasure meekely upon knee besought peace verily hee obtained pardon graunted past condition redeliver men captive find souldiors food oft needfull manner base vassales received mercie protection taking onely securitie life whatsoever brought hee shewed time occasion required might well know wearied againe therewith thus well ordered disposed fulfilled accordingly without faile march also territorie king named hortarius nothing seemed wanting guide caesar gave commaundement unto nestica tribune scutarij chariton man admirable strength valour diligence seeke find take present unto one captive expedition aleman youth caught brought unto promised upon capitulation covenanted life saved discover shew wayes thus went afore armie following impeached going still barricado high tree cut downe lying way wheeling fetching long winding circuit came length place aforesaid armed souldiors every one angrie mood fell fiering field harrying away cattell folke yea without mercie hewing piece many made resistance king sore troubled disquieted adverse accident saw many territory spoyled beheld withall remaines townes village consumed fire considering finall ruine whole estate hand himselfe also besought pardon execrable oath taken doe whatsoever imposed upon promised also make restitution generally captive capitulation condition much stood upon earnestly urged delivered detained part knowne iulian provoked indignation insomuch said king came manner gift bestowed upon foure follower accompanied whose assistance fidelitie affiance would dismisse captive returned howbeit caesar sent conference parle adored trembling eye even overcome againe sight conqueror driven hard exigent condition namely much meet requisit many prosperous atchievements city also barbarian forcibly rased destroied reedified charge himselfe people must find cariage timber c building promised doe withall wished dealt way disloyally make satisfaction losse heart bloud permitted returne home transporting thither corne victual might bee compelled thereto suomarius countrey utterly wasted could meet nothing therein give mogontiacum florentius lupicinus successour severus urged hard must passe bridge set erected caesar stiffely stood saying ought tread land within peace feare least oftentimes falleth uncivile behaviour souldiors spoyling wilfully ever come way covenant league rudely broken howbeit alemans generall armie marched thinking danger came towards warned minatorie tearmes king suomarius agreement composition past become friend unto u debarre romanes passage townes territory lay close farther bankes rhene protesting himselfe alone able barbarian multitude assembling together approched mogontiacum readie power impeach armie crosse river two respect therefore thought convenient caesar advised namely feare land peaceable confederats spoyled least while warlike nation readie make resistance bridge danger many men life set place indeed meet framing bridge enemy wisely considered marching softly along contrarie banke looke saw afarre men pitch tent also paralele overagainst attended night slept observing right vigilant care passage attempted men come place provided sat downe rested within precinct trench rampier caesar taking lupicinus counsell commaunded certaine serjeant major tribune make readie three hundred souldiors lightly appointed stake altogether ignorant doe whether goe gotten together farre night going aboord fortie small pinnace barge even many hand received willed row along river silence oares hold give light stroke feare noise wave might raise barbarian readie mind active body breake frontier bankes overagainst while enemy amused fire men made meane thing setting forward speed hortarius king made hand confederate minding alter aught otherwise tenour covenant went withall friend unto neighbourborderers invited assembled together king prince bloud lord potentate feast kept good cheare according manner countrey held unto third midnight watch night departed men aforesaid chaunce set upon unawares meanes could either kill catch reason darknesse swift horse withall carried quite away whither doubtfull braid driven lacquies servant followed foot slew unlesse obscuritie time saved danger length knowne romanes passed king also time expedition past supposed take easement labor happened found enemy strucken astenied people also watched bridge great care diligence made quaking feare betooke heeles thus unbridled furie assuaged made hast could remoove neerest deerest friend farther presently difficultie past bridge set together project carefull nation prevented souldiors seene barbarian land passed dominion hortarius without hurt come territory king yet enemy without feare made foule worke throughout middest rebel countrey burning spoyling set light fire mound fence brittle house hewed piece number folke seene many falling downe others making supplication came farre countrey named capellatij palas certaine mere stone parted confines betweene alemans burgundians encamped reason macrianus hariobaudus brother germanes king might bee received without dread perceiving destruction drew neere came carefull heavie heart entreat peace immediately repaired king vadomarius also whose habitation rauraci commendatorie letter prince whether emperour grandfather uncertaine constantius secretly brought earnestly alledged gently entertained long since taken protection romane empire macrianus verily brother admitted among eagle ensignes wondered varietie braverie armour force never saw entreated behalfe people vadomarius acquainted men neighbouring upon limit marvailed assure munition furniture stately sumptuous expedition remembred well prime youth many time seene like conclusion long consultation thing well weighed considered unto macrianus verily hariobaudus peace graunted vadomarius intending establish owne securitie firme sure come also way embassage oratour behalfe vrius vrsicinus versalpus king heartily desiring peace could meane time suddainely answere feare least barbarian fickle hardly bee trusted bethinking remembring departure men would stand point others beene obtained also upon fiering standing corne house upon taking also many prisoner killing number made humble suit likewise trespassed kind people got peace semblable condition among instantly urged redeliver captive whome many outrodes taken carried away chap iii barbatio colonell infanterie assyria wife attaint high treason beheaded while heavenly providence reformeth abuse gaule riseth emperours court turbulent tempest new matter small beginning proceeded sorrowfull mourning lamentation house barbatio colonell every turne fighting manfully without desire live driven wee unto bankes tigris stood high cut rocke whence thrust headlong stucke fast armour weapon encumbring river shallow yeeldeth foords others civile courteous deportment xix booke chap sapor lifted small victorie besiegeth amida without danger sonne king grumbates young gentleman pierced bodie shot balist royall funeral lamented king right joyous miserable captivitie happened part waiting still like success departed thence marching softly came third day amida daylight first appeared countrey farre could seene shone againe glittering armour weapon men armes bard horse complete harneis covered hill dale himselfe mounted upon courser higher rest advaunced whole armie wearing lieu diademe resemblance ram head gold set precious stone goodly seene aloft accompanied traine many high personage honourable place diver sundrie nation certaine knowne meant way parley onely farther sound defendant wals hastening advice antoninus another way heavenly power conclude misery whole empire rome within compasse one region restrained curbed infinitely bare himselfe aloft weened verily upon sight besieged would streightwaies feare become heartlesse fall humble manner entreatie gate rode braving downe accompanied guard royall band while overboldly engageth himselfe neere visage might openly knowne faire marke reason goodly ornament shot arrowes castingweapons whereby surely beene overthrowne layed along dust arose archer darter lost sight rent part garment shot barbedheaded javelin gat away escaped afterwards infinit deale mischiefe hereupon raging lesse beene sacrilegious spoylers holy temple giving lord many king nation violated hee made great preparation mightily endevoured utterly rase destroy citie chiefe principall captaines besought falling thus excessive fit choler would give leave gloriousbegun enterprise mild petition pacified decreed morrow also defendant might bee summoned surrender therefore first breaking day grumbates king chionites performe diligent service behalfe boldly approched wall strong guard right expert nimble servitours sooner espied comming within reach dart shot skilfull archer good eye bending crossebow hee levelled sonne prime youthfull yeares stood close father side pierced curace shot breast gallant gentleman talnesse personage goodly presence surmounting equal age whose fall countreymen slipped away every one fled returning anone againe upon good reason due consideration least harried away strucke alarme raysed together number nation dissonant outcry whose concourse encounter while dart flew fro thicke hayle cruell fight deadly skirmish lasted end day grew night corpes much adoe protected hardly mist darknesse night gotten among heapes slaine body streames running downe bloud much like troy time past right hote bloudie conflict breathlesse bodie patroclus companion thessalian leader achilles occasion death king house heavie sad lord noble together father strucken suddaine losse proclamation vacation made young prince commendable nobilitie birth well beloved solemnely bewayled mourned guise owne nation therefore carried armed used bee placed upon certaine large high raysed terrace scaffold tenne little bed spread carrying image dead men curiously dressed embaulmed portrait like unto body new enterred thus space seven dayes together men verily band company kept good cheare dauncing singing certaine mournefull kind dumpes sorrowfull dities bewayled death young prince woman wofull knocking breast shedding teares wonted manner piteously cried lamented hope nation thus untimely cut prime flower age like world woman priest worshipper venus oftentimes seene weepe ordinarie feast solemnity adonis mysticall religion teacheth u representation corne full growne chap ii description siege amida terrible hote assault made persian besieged manfully sustaine untill night corpes burnt bone bestowed close within silver pot father determined carried unto owne nation enterred upon debating counsell touching main chaunce agreed expiate mane young gentleman slaine generall fire citie overthrowne grumbates would endure goe without revenging ghost deere sonne two day rest given great number sent wast rich well husbanded field lying open manner peace citie environed fivefold ranke course shield upon third day betimes morning glittering troupe standing round plump tooke ground farre man able looke see rankes marching soft gentle pace held place divided lot unto persian invested circuit wals part looked eastward fell chionites quarter young gentleman mortall mischiefe u slaine vertae appointed south side albanes kept north tract west gate opposed segestans fiercest warrior others elephant making loftie shew terrible behold body full wrinckles paced ground softly loaden armed men wee often said dreadfull sight exceeding foule spectacle whatsoever beholding infinite number sought long time set fire romane world wholly bent worke destruction full dispaire safetie tooke care thenceforth end life glorie onely thing wee wished well sunnerising end day stood battaillons array fixed fast ground never stirred much shifting foot without noise neighing horse heard manner retyred came refreshed meat sleepe night fully past sound trumpet leading way beset citie round gave terrible assault unto within would fallen scarcely grumbates like herault armes launced owne countrey fashion manner also speare died red bloud whole armie clattering noise weapon mounteth wals streight way beginneth hote lamentable fight while one side whole troupe run violently resolution alacritie bend assault cont iwise men eager forward encounter receive therefore came passe huge stone throwne engins called scorpion brake many enemy head piece brained shot arrowes part barbed dart javelines sticking lay wounded bespred ground others ran away fled fast could toward fellowes againe neither within citie lesse weeping wayling fewer sort death while many cloud arrowes flying thicke together multitude shaddowed darkened ayre while also engine ordinance artillerie persian possessed since sacking singara much hurt inflicted many wound defendant gathering strength together falling afresh fight againe turnes given time exceeding heat defending towne mortally hurt fell downe dead torne mangled tumbling overturned stood next leastwise while yet alive sought skill draw foorth arrow dart head stucke fast body thus slaughter happening one necke another continuing unto latter end day darknesse evening slacked reason part stiffely set fight outrance watch therefore kept heavily armed weaponed hils one side resounded againe cry set while men extolled vertues constantius caesar soveraigne emperour lord world persian part styled sapor achaemenes artaxerxes way interpretation import much commaunder king conquerour warres day began peepe upon signall given trumpet inestimable number force raised side flocked ran rashly foorth huge deale castingweapons flew wals might well thinke none discharged vaine falling amongst number men stood thicke together considering beset round many danger bore self fight right fiercely would save life said wee desired die manfully beginning day untill twylight evening victorie swayed side still fighting hand fiercely advisedly arose hideous outcry one terrifying frighting another heat courage hardly could man stand ground without receiving hurt length night made end slaughtering satietie painefull travail yeelded part longer respite cessation fight wee time given rest beeing mounted upon swift stead gallopped away bridle necke escaped yet yeoman guard while laboured keepe villain back flashing upon like flame fire lost life beeing crushed weight onely fell upon king throne together cushion cloth gold stollen carried away while man gainesay within little newes came emperour beene plunged well neere extreame jeopardie stood yet upon sure ground armie supposing chiefest first thing rescue thought quite rid yet danger presuming confidently good hand save life armed though half ran fight suddainely gnashing teeth also rung againe fell souldiors use doe engaged cruell feat howbeit among care thought trumpet sounded full blast according certaine received custome old lieu civile warres certaine matter imputation coloured deepely crime majestie high treason gaine commoditie obstinate setled purpose doe hurt forbare also theeve steale devising innocent person sundrie cause imputation tending mischiefe overthrow long hand damnable salary small base occasion ministred matter examination infinitely extended towne named abydus elsium ortelio acutich caestaldo abydum seated furthest part province thebais oracle god called place be old time revealed thing come wont honor worship done unto according auncient ceremony country lying round much personally present others sending script shewed desirous know expresse forme supplication conceived asked counsell divine power piece paper parchment contained request petition remained otherwhiles even answeres given chappell upon malicious intent sent unto emperour man base mind carrying deafe eare matter even great weight importance became particular cause information presented unto passing tractable suspitious besides prepared hand naturally bitter gall soone heat caught fire immediately therefore warned paulus speed go east armed warrant commission captaine renowmed experience world hee cause matter heard pleasure likewise emploied businesse modestus lieutenant overall east man fitted like affaire hermogenes ponticus time praefectus praetorio rejected one mild temper well paulus according hee commaunded set forward journey full deadly furie carrying pernicious breath graunted libertie therefore preferre slander false endictments number brought question part manner earth well noble birth obscure parentage whereof put paine hard streight bond others died pent close youth used please pacifie god never sounded searched high matter much know man affected desired continuing therefore long time set fast racke surely grounded upon firme confidence persisted fearelesse
