man sight doth faile suppose departed gone place let u returne purposed hystorie chap iii vertues iulianus gaule constantius heart minded take auxiliarie force souldiors favouring iulian stand partly open mouth partly casting abroad libell while constantius made hast succour east like shortly infested persian outrodes according fugitive intelligencers one accord declared vexed envie vertues iulianus generall bruit blazed abroad talked dayly among sundrie nation loftie praise whose great travailes exploit fame carried divulged world namely certaine kingdomes alemain conquered hee recovered townes gaule sacked aforetime rased barbarous enemy hee made tributary subject pay impost moved regard like matter fearing least would grow greater considering report went florentius praetorium praefect pricked hee sent decentius tribune chauncellor notarie fetch away forthwith heruli batavi celt also together petulantes three hundred besides chosen foorth band colour commaunded make speed might bee readinesse warre beginning spring upon parthian touching aidsouldiors verily three hundred bee levied gathered lupicinus certaine knowne passed yet britannie dealt withall apart himselfe scutarij gentile sintula tribune time caesar table commaundement draw foorth greatest activitie bring along himselfe iulian held tongue condiscended hereunto submitting pleasure mightier person howbeit one thing could neither dissimule passe silence urge instantly might suffer trouble leaving habitation beyond rhene come capitulation condition time led unto part beyond alpes avouching bee feared least voluntarie souldiors barbarian oftentimes upon tearmes condition wont come side u taking knowledge hereof might hereafter kept backe performing like service speech came nothing sayd sintulae tribune making account caesar complaint obeyed emperours commaundement hee made choise companie lightly appointed lively vigour delivernesse bodie surpassed others hee went foorth hoping confidently greater matter caesar pensive bee done rest commaunded sent casting mind diver sundrie thought deemed businesse ought managed good heed circumspection seeing also cruell barbarian one side powerfull commaund enforce especially absence generall horseman made doubt hee willed praefect returne unto beforetime departed vienna colour provide victual might exempt himselfe militarie trouble praefect well considered according relation thought time past sent warlike band dreadfull alreadie barbarian bee withdrawne defence gaule received caesar letter advising requesting come speed assist commonwealth counsell obstinately drew backe refused mind feare troubled regard letter plainely imported thus much praefect ought parted chiefe imperatore generall commander heat broile fearefull stirres thus much moreover written case hee held performe service accordingly himselfe owne accord would cast ensignes princely authoritie taking honourable glorious die commaundement destruction province imputed unto stiffe constant resolution praefect prevailed might striving againe refusing yeeld obedience thing reason required howbeit time delayes lupicinus absent souldiors mutiny iulian company petulantes closely let fall upon ground libell many content carried tenor also thus verily driven confined guiltie condemned person unto furthest part earth leife deere unto u shall bee slave diademe set upon head approched comming iulian prince met place village neere city side manner commending knew putting every one mind doe valiantly mild word animated goe cheerefully unto emperour whose power ample large also get condigne reward travailes paine honourably entreat thus depart great way hee invited chiefe principall feast willed confidently preferre lawfull petition could readily thinke wherein might pleasure thus liberally entertained tooke leave malecontent sorrowfull regard twofold griefe certaine unkind fortune thus severed temperate governour also native soyle thus possessed anxietie retyred unto usuall campe sooner began bee night brake open brawle set blouds according every man found himselfe aggreeved unexpected occurrent take weapon hand mightie noyse palace went compassed round man could escape get away hideous terrible clamour cried unto iulianus name augustus urging speed come forth unto beeing compelled stay untill daylight forced length goe forth saw iterating great noyse shout firme settled consent styled augustus part upon resolute grounded mind withstood one shewing himselfe wroth highly displeased otherwhiles stretching forth hand requesting beseeching many happie fortunate victory undecent unseemely part committed unseasonable rashnesse breaking rayse matter cause discord end mild speech appeased tumult thus much moreover added sayd let angrie mood pray cease without dissention seditious seeking alteration yee demaund shall easily obtained much yee possessed thus sweetnesse native countrey feare go strange land yee acquainted returne yee even hand unto owne home see shall nothing beyond alpes displeasant unto hereof assoyle competent satisfaction emperour prince capable reason prudent withall word set lowd crie side god save augustus nathelesse one uniforme zeale heat affection preassed still exceeding earnest noyse mixed reprochfull reviling tearmes caesar enforced condiscend unto set upon footman shield borne aloft sight great silence people declared augustus hee willed bring forth white band diademe said never called one wife used necke head affirmed meet fitted first entrance empire woman ornament attire sought horse trapping end handsomely adorned therewith might make shew yet obscure though higher authoritie still avouched also base unseemely one named maurus afterwards come captaine discoverer espiall received foile fight strait succi time serving qualitie pikeman tooke collar owne necke wore b ensigne bearer boldly upon iulians head thus driven extremitie perceiving hee could avoid present danger persevered still make resistance promised unto throughout five c aurei apeece every one pound silver besides matter thus passed lesse troubled care foreseeing quicke conceit might afterwards come hereof neither wore ademe durst go abroad ne yet negotiate serious business never urgent while iulianus affrighted sundrie accident betooke thus privat retyrednesse certaine decurie meaneth since secret manner duly observed kept entrie thy house desirous encrease thy dignitie diver time gone wayes reiected bee time received admitted namely iudgements many agree one goe forlorne sorrowfull howbeit take thee set deepely thy heart longer dwell thee chap vi king persian while constantius abode farre invadeth mesopotamia forceth citie singara hewed piece two romane legion carried rest well citizen souldiors away unto furthest part persis while thing earnestly gaule cruell king persian burning hote desire kindled first antonine redoubled comming craugasius bee lord mesopotamia while constantius abode farre armie augmented armed force passed usuall manner tygris setteth hand assault singra athanasio singara citie well fortified souldiors thing else necessarie requisit deemed government country defender place espied enemie great way quickly shut gate stout courageous heart ran fro along turret battlement gathering together great stone warlike engine discharge upon thus made readie beforehand stood armour prest repell multitude enemy attempted climbe wals king therefore come mediation noble captaines admitted approch neere hee might gentle mild parle persuade defendant yeeld unto pleasure gave whole dayes respite next morning betimes breake day setting signall firered banner assayled citie every side while brought skaling ladder others planted engine part defended fence timber hurdle also penthouse head sought wayes undermine foundation wall devise townesmen standing upon high bulwarkes munition stone sort castingdarts afarre repelled venturously proudly presumed put forward within reach shot thus continued fighting certaine day together doubtfull event many man side lost life many wounded last skirmish hot evening came one exceeding strong ram among engine brought forward push thick threefold butted upon round tower former siege said citie breach layed open vnto tower multitude came rescue fought closely might man seene firebrand burning torch fierie dart flying every way burn mischievous engine approched neere neither gave thicke shot arrowes bullet either side sharpe pointed head said ram went beyond device entering piercing joynts stone new layed yet reason moisture weake feeble fight continued still fire sword tower aforesaid fell downe wherby way made citie place disfurnished defendant whome great danger imminent scattered wherupon whole troupe band persian setting yelling outcrie filled part towne while none restraine slaine pell mell one another rest commaundement king sapor taken alive carried away furthest country persia two legion garrison defence citie wit e prima flavia f prima parthica besides many homelings naturall inhabitant together auxillarie horseman whose hap reason suddaine danger shut within said led hand bound while none men helped greater part armie lay field encamped defence nisibis citie farre distant otherwise never could man much old time succour singara distresse reason place round want water dried albeit antiquitie built fort fit convenient place discoverie adverse suddaine trouble yet turned alwayes detriment romanes sundry time surprized taken losse defendant thereof chap vii sapor king persia setteth upon bezabde otherwise called phoenicha great violence assaulteth racing therefore towne king wisedome policie avoiding nisibis one ywis well remembring hurt many time sustained tooke right hand way marching crooked winding journeyes minding either force winning unto garrison defendant sweet promise recover bezabde auncient founder tearmed also phoenicha strong fort situate upon pretie high hill bending toward bankes tygris place either suspected low fenced double wall defence piece three legion deputed secunda g flavia secunda h armeniaca likewise parthica secunda together many zabdicene archer whose ground time subjection stood towne first brunt therefore king person accompanied troupe horseman glittering complete harneis himselfe mounted higher rest riding circuit bulwarkes fortification approched venturously brim edge trench albeit assayled shot balists missed marke arrowes flying thicke yet reason hee good armour proofe wrought manner roufe tortoiseshell went away without taking harme howbeit sequestring setting apart anger time sent manner heraulds whome hee gently exhorted besieged would looke unto life hope yeelding time raise siege setting open gate goe forth humble manner present unto conqueror nation heraulds adventured approch neere regard defendant wals forbare brought close side certaine gentleman freeborne acquaintance taken prisoner singara pitifull respect man flung dart made answer touching peace cessation armes graunted one whole day night daylight next morrow persian setting fiercely upon rampier gave cruell threat terrible noyse comming boldly wall preassed hard upon townesmen great force resisted whereby parthian sore hurt carrying ladder others holding hurdle oysiers went blindly forward within shot neither escaped men without hurt arrowes flying thicke like hayle went stood close together sunne set departed part equall losle toward next morning fought much eagrely while trumpet sounded one side neither lesse flaughter seene either hand fighting obstinately side chap viii sapor reiecting admonition christian bishop force winneth besieged citie fareth cruelly townesmen given attempt upon virta strong fenced citie relinquished vaine enterprise length departeth bvt day following truce common assent manyfold travaile paine taken graunted time great terror presented round wall persian feared lesse christian bishop shewed certaine signes gesture beckening willing goe foorth upon faithfull promise returne safe conduct came farre king pavilion leave given speake mind mild manner speech persuaded persian depart home part received common lamentable loss saying withall greater sorrowes yet bee feared happily would come unto hee stood discoursing like point vaine fell outrageous furie king withstood motion stoutly swore would depart towne fortification destroyed yet bishop somewhat suspected untruly thinke though commonly many men vouched secret conference talke hee informed sapor part wall assault weake withinforth easie battered seemed carrie likelyhood afterwards enemy engine evidently seene great shout joyous leaping assaylants play lustily upon undefensible place age rottennesse began leane readie fall knew inward secret citie given direction albeit narrow wayes yeelded difficult accesse unto wall ram fitted batterie hardly set forward feare stone throwne hand arrowshot kept yet ceased eyther brake scorpion wherof discharged stone thicke sent dart fast together basket pannier burning besmeared pitch k bitumen continuall fall whereof comming still downe hill sayd engine artillerie stucke fast fixed rooted deepe within ground beeing thus set fierie dart burning linkes together throwne lustily good arme star hand set light fire although case stood thus many side slaine yet assaylants hotely set rase destroy towne naturall situation strong also great workemanship man hand fortified ere middest winter persuaded king rage would allayed therefore neither effusion much bloud number shot bodie deadly wounded could reclayme rest like boldnesse long time maintained fight much hurt mischiefe gotten thereby length exposed extreame present danger drave rammes weightie stone comming thicke wals sundrie fireworkes debarred going forward howbeit one ram higher fellowes covered wet bull hide therefore lesse danger mishap flame dart going much straining endevour crept wall mightie sharpe pointed head entring betweene joint stone losened overthrew tower beeing fallen wonderfull crashing noyse also stood upon suddain ruine thereof throwne downe eyther breaking bone overwhelmed rubbish died sundry death unlooked thus armed multitude found safe ascent rushed hideous noyse persian made yelling cry every side thundered resounded fearefull eares townesmen thus overmatched fight grew hote close within wals while enemy squadron fought hand considering standing body one another thicke sword drawne side one spared stood way conclusion besieged resisting long time much adoe mischiefe side length pressing hard huge multitude disranked scattered heapes angry enemy put sword whomsoever could find small babe plucked mother bosomes mother also killed man regarded yet meane time bloudie nation greedie pillage carnage loaden kind rich spoyles leading away exceeding great number prisoner went backe much rejoycing tent king puffed extraordinarie joy one long time burned desire win phaenicha strong fenced piece great importance departed thence hee right strongly repayred part wall shattered layed store plentie victual bestowed garrison armed men birth good note skill martiall feat renowmed feared fell indeed least romanes taking heart losse mightie strong hold would addresse maine force besiege vaunting therefore bearing himselfe big fed hope win whatsoever could go hand surprized taken meaner pile determined set upon iu ta virta sort great antiquitie insomuch thought beene built alexander king macedonia seated verily utmost part mesopotamia encircled wals winding pointed horne reason sundry device meanes made unaccessable assayed skill art one alluring defendant goodly promise otherwhiles threatening hang crucifie sundry time going hand raise bankes mount bringing engine pertaining siege wound loss received given gave vaine enterprise end departed act atchieved yeare betweene tygris euphrates constantius learned relation many messenger fearing parthian expedition while wintered constantinople greater care furnished frontier warlicke provision setting also armour together new trained souldiors strengthening likewise legion supply strong young men set battailes legionarie souldiors oftentimes sped well warres service east part besides sought scythian aid either money love mid spring setting forth journey thracia might forthwith seize hand place suspected chap ix iulianus good regard himselfe long epistle endevoureth pacifie mind constantius meane iulian placed wintering harbour paris much fearing would end begun enterprise sore perplexed casting tossing many matter mind considered constantius would wise like doings whose conceit eye reputed vile base contemptible person advising well therefore fearefull beginning innovation change state empire resolved send unto embassadours declare occurrent happened withall dispatched letter agreeable unto wherin plainely advertised shewed done ought afterwards done although supposed hee heard good report decentius long since returned also gentleman chamber newly come againe backe gaule carried unto caesar certaine solemne present albeit unwilling hereunto yet wrote nothing arrogant tearmes least might thought suddainely revolted tenour letter went wise faithfull allegeance according purpose lesse accustomed behaviour covenant agreement verily part carrying alwayes one mind time hitherto kept performed many effectuall proofes hath evidently appeared ever since created caesar exposed terrible noise battailes contenting selfe place commaund wherein set like trustie servitour officer filled eares evermore newes prosperous atchievements performed wish heart desire attributing nothing mine owne peril adventure whereas dayly example continuall proofes well knowne germanes spred abroad intermingled every painefull travailes others seene first repose refection last may good leave say much case chaunge alteration thinke hence commeth souldiors spending yeares many warres right dangerous without reaping fruit service effected tumultuous manner length long since determined impatient serve commaunder second place seeing caesar could recompence made long labour many victory whose anger neither found augmentation dignity touched yearely wage also fallen unlooked aggravate matter beeing men acquainted cold frozen country commaunded come utmost part east world drawne away needie bare apart wife child whereupon enraged wonted manner night assembled together beset palace loud voice often reiterated styling iulian name augustus set trembling confesse withdrew selfe thus long could keepe way sought save selfe holding peace hiding head would give time respite consider upon matter fenced may say wall free pure heart went forth stood sight supposing tumultuous rising might eyther authoritie countenance gentle word allayed howbeit grew wonderfull heat went farre assayed overcome stubborne obstinacie entreatie instantly menaced death seemed violent assault following one necke another end overcome reasoning thus mine owne selfe stabbed perhaps willingly ynough would declared prince gave assent yet hoping still assuage franticke armed violence order manner proceeding beseech entertaine peaceable gentle construction neither thinke thing hath beene done otherwise admit malicious person evill willers readie whisper eares pernicious matter meane wont owne gaine advantage make debate variance betweene prince putting aside flatterie nourice vice set mind upon iustice excellent vertue others receive unfainedly bona fide equall condition propose vnto reasoning reckoning thus mind thing behoofefull romane state u neerenesse bloud height supreme fortune conioined pardon pray desire much thing done reason required profitable honest course approved whose commaundements even henceforth still purpose right willingly embrace meane need requireth performed short allow unto regard soveraigne preheminence spanish horse chariot chosen piked young men entermingled among gentile scutarij race barbarous nation discended side rhene leastwise yeeld revolt side enterprise iulian aggravated made much departure florentius praefect praesaging trouble would arise abovesaid sending souldiors commonly spoken purpose departed vienna pretending excuse regard want victual caesar parted truth dreaded hee oftentimes hardly entreated afterwards understood hee mounted imperiall throne little hope none life became fearefull farre removed delivered himselfe danger doubted leaving neerest friend kinsfolke behind went aside soft journeyes came unto constantius shew himselfe lyable fault many imputation charged upon iulian traytor state whose departure iulian considering well wisely matter willing also knowne spared present gave commaundement wife child held dearest together good touched diminished returne safetie east part allowing take benefit publicke citie good importance well frequented situate foot mountaine argeus beeing admitted presence permission graunted unto delivered missive sooner read emperour grew choler indignation beyond usuall manner looking awrie upon feared death commaunded goe forth could abide afterwards eyther move question unto heare speake howbeit great heat hee strucken yet hee stood doubtfull mammering whether command force wherein hee trusted march persian iulian sticking thus long time weighed sundrie counsel hee gave eare advice persuaded good proclaimed journey eastward yet angrie mood soone dismissed embassadours aforesaid also appointed leonas treasurer quaestor ride speed gaule letter also written unto iulian affirming nothing liked new change alteration charging hee regarded safetie owne person neerest friend lay downe swelling pride vanitie containe himselfe within power government caesar feare menaced might sooner induce thereto presumed bare himselfe highly great force promoted nebridius excursion invasion still barbarous enemy word heard leonas letter iulian importing returned safe nebridius alone admitted praefectship much caesar also openly sayd letter stand good pleasure master office little ordained anatolius man time place give answere unto request like made officer according thought meet owne behoofe safetie much among proceeding hee feared lupicinus though absent making abode britannie prowd minded man swelling nature hee suspition jealousie knew thus much beyond sea would stirre matter alteration rebellion chauncellor notarie sent bologne bononia observe watch carefully man might suffered passe narrow sea meanes prohibition lupicinus returned tooke knowledge newes able raise trouble howbeit iulian right joyous man regard higher fortune confidence souldiors seene artificially set together fitted accordingly daunted heart besieged fallen manner last remedie yeelding tooke heart againe prepared oppose meanes terrible menacing engin neither gave men one jot flame colour spreadeth abroad turneth blew greene others opinion forme rainebow appeareth thing beneath world beames sunne infused deepely thicke cloud carried high cast cleere light finding issue bank farther within sea without mixture blew azure signe change weather wee said namely cleere aire gathering heapes cloud contrariwise thicke aire making change faire pleasant weather therefore read obliged fealtie like oath nebridius praefect onely man companie although inward purpose sure ynough stedfast yet boldly refused sweare saying might bound oath constantius unto many benefites sundrie fortune chap v act constantius performed domesticall militarie while wintered antioch meet unfold time past recount summarily act constantius wintering antiochia atchieved home warres abroad while affaire aforesaid passed gaule among many right honourable personage came strange country doe reverence unto emperour also captaines tribune better sort men marke appointed thereunto therefore constantius returned mesopotamia received kind dutie one amphtlochius paphlagonian beene tribune long while served constans deepely suspected upon presumption carried likelyhood truth sowed matter quarell discord among elder constantinus constantius brother presuming verie sawsily stand place end himselfe also might admitted like obsequious service known debarred many muttered hereat yea cried worthy live longer obstinat stiffenecked traytor constantius matter mild otherwise hee used surcease quoth trouble man thinke guiltie yet openly convicted remember yee committed matter mine eye shall receive punishment doome owne conscience cannot hidden departed day following amphilochius solemne game circenses stood beholding sight woont emperor upon setting sudden shout sending forth expected game masterie performed railer crossebarres many others leaned brake peeces together fell downe ground slightly hurt hee alone found rupture within ri b lly midriffe yeelded ghost whereupon constantius skilfull also foreknowledge haply divined hereby uli n concurrent likewise perish set himselfe said tribu e done time siding stood opposit unto thing come rejoiced much time espoused tooke wife faustina good buried eusebia brother eusebius hypatius men consul degree lady bodily beautie commendable behaviour excelling number yet high estate right curteous whose favour shewed iulian delivered danger declared caesar time also good regard florentius feare alteration state departed gaule occasion anatolius praefectus praetorio illyricum late deceased hee sent take place together taurus likewise praefectus praetorio italie hee received ensignes g highest honourable confulship office neverthelesse preparation made meanes warre well foraine civile number also horseman troups gentle nothing bloudily minded insomuch constantius commaunded put certaine innocent person torture presence verie well content bee deprived place besought matter might committed others better himselfe accomplished according prince mind chap vi sort constantius provided instant affaire politike speed iulian made setting designes forward constantius therefore difficultie urgent business standing doubtfull seeke course take one along time much troubled mind whether goe iulian country farre repel parthian upon point threatned passe euphrates sticking thus equall ballance end consulted oftentimes captain enclined wholly way namely finished least wise appeased neerer warre left behind back enemy might feare sc avonia illyria italy thought daunted quelled take iulian hunter prey verie beginning enterprise allay feare owne souldiers verie word otherwhiles gave forth hee would bee thought waxe coole omitted side warre foot minding disperse spread terror comming place fearing withall least africke countrey fit commodious emperour occasion might befall absence invaded hee beene departed march east sent thither sea gaudentius chancellor secretarie notarie meane briefely touched lay spie good observe proceeding iulian gaule hoped hee obsequious quicke service would able effect two regard first feared adverse iulian part offended hee made hast meanes good opportunitie commend doings unto constantius made doubt would get victorie man contrarie opinion fully mind gaude tiu thither come carrying mind charge prince given letter instructed cretio captaine lieutenant bee done also rest commaunders made choyce stoutest souldiers place yea brought barbari mauritaniae nimble light appointed skirmisher kept straitly sea coast lay opposite unto guitune martiano gascoigne remigio florentino acquitanie gaule neither failed constantius purpose policie long lived none adverse part set foot land although number armed men observed coast sicilie reaching capo bo capo coco lilybaeum cabo passato pachynus readie soone sayle passage beene cleere open constantius disposed small lighter matter thought considering thing stood expedient advertised messenger letter captaines force persian assembled together conduct proud sapor king leading way tendere encamping marching neere unto edge tigris doubtfull whither went breake make invasion newes much moved end making abode neerer might prevent attempt departed speed wintering harbour sending part horseman strength infanterie wherein trusted passed euphrates capessana upon bridge ship went rhoa nigro edessa citie stored victual strongly fenced waiting untill either owne discoverer else fugitive brought word enemy encamped forward meane iulian departing rauraci hee dispatched businesse ere shewed sent backe gaule sallustius promoted praefect commaunded germanianus hold roome nebridius semblably one charge horseman appeareth little beneath mastership armour committed unto nevita fearing gumoarius old traitor heard say while leading scutarij secretly betrayed veteranio prince soveraign also iovius gave treasurership houshold questorship made mention act magnentius unto mamertinus charge state empire treasure revenewes dagalaiphus ordained steward seneschal houshold captaine h domesticall traine others according owne pleasure whose good desert faithfull service hee well knew souldiers therefore make journey martian wood wayes joyning upon bank river ister among sudden occurrent exceeding uncertaine doe hee feared especially one thing least traine accompanie grow despised offend offenderes multitude readie repugne repine prevent inconvenience good forecast tooke wise course dividing armie diver regiment sent leading iovinus iovius march speed along knowne wayes italie others committed conduct nevita tearmed magistrum armorum generall horse end thus spread sundrie wayes might thought infinit number fill place feare terrour even thus alexander great many skilfull leader case required howbeit hee gave charge unto thus gone forth march stand well upon guard enemie forthwith readie encounter keepe watch ward night station sentinel least might outrode unawares set upon business beeing thus thought well digested following manner whereby oftentimes broken barbarian tract presuming confidently upon continued traine success hee went still farther farther come place whence understood river navigable embarked fisher boat whereof hap found good store along chanell river passed closely possibly could keeping himselfe therfore secret finding misse fine viand contenting himselfe slender course dyet hee passed beside good townes without forth securely laying rule follow notable saying old cyrus turning way hostelrie asked host good cheere provide answered bread onely hope quoth sup neere unto river chap vii fame iulians comming chaseth away certaine captaines adverse part lucillianus thinking make head sodainly taken prisoner word rebuked chastised strait pass illyricum thracia great celeritie intercepted iulianus fortified bvt fame thousand tongue folke say multiplies report thing exceedingly much talke spread sclavonians illyrian iulian overthrown number king gaule vanquished armie manie nation bearing himselfe proud sundrie success comming neere hand rumor taurus praefect praetorium stricken feare departed quickly auoyding lesse foreine enemie ryding away speedily change posthorses allowed state passed iulian alpes trice florentius praefect likewise away howbeit lucillianus come time country charge commaund force moved sleight intelligence touching stirre trouble iulian made abode sirmium gathering souldiers together many speedie execution businesse hand would permit bee sent proper station intended make head hee come like firebrand casting dart set fire hastening swiftly hee flew finall end appointed journey sooner come bonmonster simlero bononia standeth mile sirmium old moone therefore shining greater part night leapt sodaine ship tooke land presently sent dagalaiphus companie light appointed men call lucillianus unto take away perforce made resistance even rest raysed troublesome noyse saw himselfe environed round companie men knew conceived presently matter hearing emperours name amazed feare obeyed commaundement though full thus little commaunder horseman bare himselfe proud stout enough yeelded pleasure another set upon horse came next hand presented unto prince base captive unneth able call wit againe together much oppressed terrour hereof verie first sight perceived leave favour granted adore purple robe hee taking heart againe last secure himselfe lord emperour quoth done unwisely rashly thus venture person upon foreine part againe iulian grim bitter kind smile reserve quoth hee wise word thine constantius ensigne imperiall maiestie reached thee counsellor thou shouldest cease feare lucillianus voided away iulianus supposing make delayes slacke businesse hand beene alwaies prince doubtfull dangerous affaire bold confident marching toward citie presumed lesse surrendred went quicke pace hee drew neere unto suburb verie large reaching great way length whole companie souldiers multitude people sort comming forth many burning light gay flower luckie vowes calling augustus lord brought royall palace taking much contentment good speed grounding hope future event lucky presage according example mother citie populous well frequented city also received gracious healthfull starre proclaimed morrow solemne game running chariot prize great joy people third morning waxed light libertie audacious act stirred italian inhabitant side constantius beene yet living iulian advertised hereof abiding naessum without feare trouble behind backe knew besides reading heresay citie ever bin diver time besieged yet never either rased rendered earnest made hast gaine owne side cunning practises sundrie sort flattery greater mischiefe might arise therefore commanded iovinus captaine another hast good advisement set cry amaine prepared encounter assaylants therefore carrying roofefences hurdle thicke wrought marched softly good heed number yron tooles assayed dig wall many brought within second enterprise wisely begun sped amisse end tower drew neere assayled shot fierie dart besmeared pitch reed also stickes twig sundrie sort fuell readie catch light fire tower quickly set burning bending forward reeling weight stood waving upon fell downe river armed men sticked engineshot farre killed top conflict footman beneath shipmate served water aloft fallen huge stone crusht swift footmanship combersome place refuge escaped length conflict continued untill toward evening sound retreat manner departed side asunder passed little remnant day diversly affected assailant upon sorrow lamentation death fellowes defendant hope winning upper hand mightily incensed yet also tooke losse owne side right heavily neverthelesse time lost allowance much one whole night sufficient recover strength rest food betimes next morning fight began afresh sound trumpet bearing shield head fight nimbly others carrying ladder upon shoulder running forward fervent violence exposed breast stroke many dart also setting hand breake yron portcluses soone fired away killed mightie stone wals went boldly passe ditch suddaine assault issued forth secretly posterne gate rushed unadvisedly sore hurt set backe safe recourse wall vaumure strengthened turfe defended waitlayers danger albeit defendant skill martiall feat surpassed helpe left wall yet souldiors picked forth best company able endure long delayes went round place neere unto citie seeking forcible meanes engine might make way breake could effect much great difficulty way began slackly lay siege unto citie stationarie garrison souldiors leaving guard centinels wasting field neere adjoyning got plentie thing meet necessarie imparted great deale booty gotten unto fellow souldiors whereby swilling deale drinke thought good since paine labour undertaken otherwise came nothing fiercely stood forced thirst yeeld whereas notwithstanding conduit pipe cut betweene spring head valiantly made resistance unto sorrowes poore wretch enformed culpable point pety high treason rigour wrathful suspitions streined stretched uttermost case inckling given thing addressing himselfe streit inquisition eagrely might stand civile justice set fell dreadfull examiner judge cause punishing went lengthen time death nature would permit one point judiciall trial cruel even gallienus many time forelaid train traitor indeed namely aureolus posthumus ingenuus valens surnamed thessalonicus many others punished otherwhiles verie mildly hainous fault would cost life man enforced fact even whereof doubt made seeme violence torment evident certaine like case hee hated death hee laboured endevoured bee reputed mercifull like drie wood sparkes flie gentle blast wind unrestrainable course reach daunger countrey townes even hee also least matter raised whole heap mischiefes misery farre unlike unto modest noble prince aurelius antoninus philosophus marcus time idius cassius way usurpation mounted offend displease would diver sound judgement opinion signe rather great vertue prince imperio coundem comitantium sine ruore c ssisse might said death empire nonlatin alphabet thing alexander sver good emperours aimed left empire without bloudshed traine privie counsell beene revenged unmercifully according doctrine also tully certaine epistle nepos taxing caesar crueltie felicitie quoth hee nothing else prosperitie honest thing may define otherwise felicitie fortune helpeth good counsel whosoever useth meanes happie therefore wicked impious counsel caesar tooke could felicitie happie iudgement camillus while hee lived exile dayes manlius although might desired raigned king aclitus also ephesian affirmeth advertiseth u brave worthy men diver time beene overcome variable event fortune worketh even idle slothfull coward moreover among principall prayses eminent authoritie placed high degree desire hurt cruell wroth subdued put yoke hath erected glorious trophie clemencie castle victorious mind prince foreine warres went away hurt foyle reason civile conflict wherein sped well bare himselfe proud occasion inward ulcer common weale embrued horrible filthy bloud whereupon perverse purpose rather usuall reared great cost charge gaule pannonia triumphall arch even losse calamitie province together title act affixed thereto men read long monument would able stand exceeding much addicted wife small puling voyces eunuch courtyers applauded every word spake observed honour sooth whatsoever hee affirmed denyed distastfull bitternesse time made worse unsatiable extortion snatching receiver importunat collector tribute tax drew hatred upon head money coffer seemed unto many intollerable never heard cause tendered indemnitie province overlayed tax tribute impost one necke another apt hee take away againe hee given perfect syncere religion christian hee blended foolish doting superstition beeing given search thereinto intricately settle gravitie hee stirred many schismes discord spread hee maintained contentious word disputation insomuch while bishop coursed downe troupe posthorses allowed state synode tearme synode labouring bring rite ceremony owne dispose thereby cut sinewes quite kept waggon hire touching forme feature bodie complexion somewhat blacke browne cast eye loftie sight quicke haire head soft cheekes alwaies shaven shining beautifully grafting necke groine long bowlegged short withall whereby leapt ran passing well well thus dead corpes embalmed chested iovianus protector u domesticus commaundement attend upon royall pompe farre constantinople enterred close unto neerest bloud unto sitting upon carroch carried reliques manner unto emperours presented essayes proofes souldiors corne victual tearme x indicia proba also publica e alia suppose meaneth posthorses camel ules horse c draught carriage service state publique beast shewed according usuall custome came upon grew together officious meeting upon way unto ordinarie course right usuall manner fame amplifie novelty hee hastened thence mounted higher higher chariot triptolemus swift passage round aire fabulous antiquitie sayth rode upon winged dragon greeke stoma greeke signifieth mouth tongue first peuce island sayd second naracustoma third calonstoma fourth pseudostoma fift boreonstoma sixt sthenostoma farre lesse rest seventh mightie great one favour men hasteneth go unto antioch act iourney therefell another occurrent encrease heape measure present joyes verily long time hoped protracted many circumstance delayes tydings came agilo iovius afterwards treasure questor defendant aquileia wearied long siege advertised constantius death set open gate went forth delivered author sturres commotion said party hath beene related afore burnt quicke rest obtained graunt pardon trespass iulian verie proud prosperous proceeding carried thought conceit beyond ordinarie compasse reach men continual proof trial found unto ruling citie rome peaceably favorable gratious fortune carrying word b cornucopia wealth aboundance presented unto glo prosperitie adding moreover unto title victory past thus much while held empire alone neither troubled civile commotion home barbarian passed beyond owne bound nation upon lust desire evermore inveigh thing past blame hurtfull noisome wonderfully inflamed earnest affection resound praise readinesse borne thus aloft favor men addressing himselfe goe antioch left constantinople supported verie great meanes flourishing estate borne loved esteemed highly place nativitie crossed therefore goddess image fallen heaven nonlatin alphabet u greeke signifieth fall others report ilus sonne tros king dardanie called place theopompus avoucheth ilus midas mightie king phrygia therefore adored solon also helpes hee opinion aegyptian priest making lawes according direction justice brought greatest strength validitie roman law also fountaines glorious wisedome imitation iupiter marching high brave loftie word seene aegypt hath warfare displayed banner aegyptians men part somewhat darke swart colour blacke much enclining melancholie leane drie upon everie motion wrathful angry litigious eagre demaunders againe arrerages dueties behind one deniall tribute could shew upon body many blacke blew markes would ashamed day could found torment violent fetch heart obdurat hardened robberie bodie thrusting casuall unexpected fall yeelded ghost stander whether want skill upon mind flatter said pretend accident unto elder two consul namely sallustius appeared foreshewed thereby death approached unto auncient yeares precedent power authoritie besides smaller foretoken likewise otherwhiles presaged happened verie beginning making preparation parthicke expedition word brought constantinople shaken earthquake skilfull soothsayer kind pronounced fortunat signe unto ruler hand overrunning another prince realme therefore advised desist unhappie enterprise affirming like token thus farre forth otherwise ought contemned invasion made forreine power one rule abideth firme perpetuall meanes stand b upon safeguard defence violence death whatsoever notwithstanding verie time intelligence given unto letter propheticall bookes sybilla commaundement perused consulted rome touching warre plaine answer forbad emperour yeare depart owne limit yet among occurrent embassadours allyes case driven upon necessitie call crave succour onely arsaces king armenia warned gather puissant force together attend pleasure quickly know whereto tended hee ought urge set forwrd wherefore commaunded passe euphrates knowne hie away speedily wintering harbour crossed river hystorie ensuing shall declare dispersed sundrie station expected prince comming chap ii departed antioch troubled haunted strange signes dreames afterwards comforted againe sundrie presage arrivall puissant armadoe proceedeth intended voyage bvt readie depart antioch made one alexander heliopolis turbulent cruell man judge syria said withal man indeed deserved place iustice meet covetous spightfull antiocheans multitude sort accompanied departure wishing happie journey glorious returne beseeching thenceforth mild gentle unto anger conceived scornfull reproofes reproach yet assuaged hee gave rough language saying would thenceforth see said determined expedition ended returne neerer way tarsus cilicia winter written memorius president town thing put readinesse fit truth fell indeed long corp brought backe thither small pompe funeral obsequies enterred himselfe gave order place neere city side weather began warme lightsome day march third day none march tooke voyage usuall journeyes came hierapolis entred gate spatious large citie gallerie left hand sodainely fell downe besides number wounded weightie fall tymber peeces tyles crushed death fiftie souldiers going whence force assembled together advanced ensignes meredi tost mesopotamia speedily rumor ran comming thereof taken verie carefull heed hee surprised assyrian unawares end upon bridge ship passed euphrates armie aid scythian came batne free towne osdroena found sorrowfull token presaging ill number campe slave stood neere unto exceeding high stack straw take thence according custome foder maner country kind farage mowed while many plucking thereat whole mow stacke shaken borne downe huge heap fell overwhelmed semblable maner fiftie men death departing thence heavie cheere rode apace came carrae auncient towne remarkeable defeature overthrow crassus roman armie whence two distinct high roadwayes leading affayres wise himselfe making semblance would goe tigris way hee commaunded also nonce bee layed provision sundrie sort furniture turned right hand hee passed night rest quietnesse morning hee called manner beast ride upon brought unto horse named babylonius happening sore vexed suddaine gripe wring belly fell downe while hee able endure paine walloweth along happeneth besprent caparison ornament richly garnished gold pretious stone strange sight tooke great joy cryed applause next baldach castald bagda c ropala according diver language hath sundry name babylon fallen lay along ground dispoyled ornament stayed untill luckie propitiatorie sacrifice hee ratified fortunate token praesage hee came devana garrison fortresse whence river belias springing poureth selfe euphrates well refreshed body meat came next day callinicum also tel callinisum strong towne defence rich chevisance quicke traffique delectable place upon sixt day calends rome annuversarie c feast solemnized great pompe honour mother god chariot carrieth image report washed streame dachia neere unto way appia runneth tyber almon auncient manner performed sacred solemnitie hee tooke rest quietly slept night whereupon hee conceived much joy contentment morrow next ensuing departed thence edge river bankes streame big occasion brooke conflowing thither every side marching warlike sort force armed weaponed tooke station abode tent potentate prince saracenes humbly upon knee presenting unto crowne gold honoured lord world nation gladly received men meet warlike brigandize robberie while communication behold arrived flet comparable armado puissant king xerxes conduct constantianus tribune lucillianus lieutena come tooke spacious river euphrates hardly able receive wherein thousand shippes burthen forme fashion balista betweene two plank set frame fast joyned strong big yron reaching length manner good great rule squire roundbodie whereof middest finely artificially made lyeth foorth farther fouresquare beame spire made hollow direct streight passage narrow riggall trough fastened hard many cord wrythen twisted sinewes thereto two wooden skrewes fitly joyned neere unto one standeth figure others veget noti wheeles one side sharpe head shaft come upmost end string sinewes aforesaid goeth shaft forcible strength within forth balista quickly flieth sight otherwhiles sparkling stand backes manner serratoria machinae sawmachine tied fast together bored side good wide hole hole strong rope tied keeping whole frame together flye start asunder midst rope riseth forth beame wood supporter even hayrecloth stuffed full small straw chaffe fastened thereto strong binding planted upon turfes heaped together else banke raised raw brick mightie engine beeing set upon wall stone forceth asunder breaketh ever findeth weight violent shake giveth therefore come point skirmish fight round stone put sling foure lustie young men one side unfolding barres whereto rope incorporate draw backe style standard hooke length master engine standing aloft giving mightie stroke hammer setteth open rayles containe binding whole worke whereupon standard libertie quicke stroke hitting soft hairecloth aforesaid hurleth stone batter whatsoever way verily called tormentum unfolding whirled hurled scorpion standing upright hath sharpe pricke unto also moderne time hath imposed name onager wild asse regard wild ass coursed hunter fling heeles stone afarre behind back pierce breast follow chase breake skuls head dash braines hence proceed ram choice made high firre wild ash one end whereof shod hard plate yron long shaped front like unto ram forme gave name engine battering piece thus hanged overthwart plankes side yron hoopes another piece timber held balance according measure country territory full plenteous withall grew one name called assyria among abundance berry vulgar fruit groweth h bitumen neere unto lake named sosingites whose belly channell tigris swallowed running ground hath gone great way ariseth appeareth engendred naphtha clammie glutinous like unto pitch also resembleth bitumen upon little bird settle looseth flight sinketh downe drowned quite sight kind liquor beginneth one catch fire man wit able devise meanes save onely dust quench put territory likewise seene gaping hole within ground whence exhaleth deadly breath vapour strong smell sent whereof killeth living creature soever standeth neere unto noysome pestilent vapor arising forth certaine deepe pit passed wide mouth thereof walmed higher caused contagiousnesse thereof ground lying round inhabitable like hole unto report seene heretofore hierapolis phrygia semblable sort hurtfull spirit aire issuing continuall smell yeelded killed whatsoever came neere unlesse guelded ussula mosse mosal gr leo ninus time past possessed kingdomes persis sheweth name ninus mightie king sometime husband semiramis also tauris castald ecbatana arbela gaugamela alexander many adventurous dangerous battails heat martiall bloud gave darius overthrow within compasse assyria number city among principall traxt rawol apamia surnamed mesene also ballera ortelio teredon apollonia vologessia ill palatium rome palatinus voice goeth image thus caried away citie burnt souldiors rifling ransacking temple met narrow hole layed open therein find precious treasure certaine sanctuarie shut sometimes privie counsellor chaldaean sprung forth originall disease corruption conceived force incurable maladie day verus marcus antoninus bound persia unto rhene gaule infected place contagion bred much mortalitie hard lyeth chaldaean countrey nourice auncient philosophie report among truth divination credit prophesies first shone foorth gave light chap viii river persia greater note many tract therein magi wonderous medicinable oyle moreover run land nobler river others named also marsyas naarmalcha mentioneth afterward signifieth much king river together euphrates passeth carrying three channel streames navigable runneth round island industrie husbandman watereth corne ground maketh pliable plough meet also breeding wood grove vpon tract joine susiani many townes among sustra castald susa holdeth head beene many time seat habitation king likewise arsiana sela arecha rest small obscure beside many river run place among excellent fellowes oates harax mesus sandie strait keepe red sea caspian sea asunder flowing sea left side cordini haith n medium confineth openeth upon servan castald hyrcane sea countrey reigne cyrus elder growth persis wee read queene asia namely subdued assy ians number whose territory changed name carrieth diver name according country coast upon atropatena possessed right warre martiall nation next parthian onely conqueror sirvan leuncl right dreadfull inhabiting certaine region shaped manner fouresquare figure inhabitant land spread farre take exceeding breadth peake passing high mountaines call zagrus orontes iasonium also dwell west part ba afi castald coronus high hill number field yeelding abundance corne wine fatnesse fertilitie right pleasant river cleare veines spring rich man shall see fresh greene meddowes shall yee find race breed generous horse auncient writer shew self seene brave men wont mounted great jolitie goe battaile give charge force call nisaei hath abundance city also medium stored village likewise built manner townes well peopled may speake fully word plentifull habitation seat king tract lye fertile field magi touching whose sect studie profession hither come convenient briefe discourse made plato also may beleeve much kept burning among perpetually upon harthes fire fell heaven men say small parcell thereof token good lucke went time past king asia number first beginning old verie small follower tayle kingdome would joine conqueror ship passed along close verie wals modest kind quietnesse without stir viewed passed fort come another strong hold named achaiacala entrenched course stadium wee came place called baraxmalcha whence wee crossed river enter diacira standing seven mile citie voyd inhabitant full corne fine white salt wherein saw temple seated upon citadell bearing loftie head citie wee burned put woman sword found also passed certain fountain issueth plentie bitumen seized towne ozogardana likewise inhabitant forsooke feare armic comming toward towne shewed armie passeth naarmalcha king river besiegeth also assaulteth pyrisabora large populous towne ovr souldiors encouraged emboldned good beginning came small towne named macepracta wherein seene remaines round another named naarmalcha way interpretation king river runneth along ctesiphon verie first entra ce whereof riseth passing high tower maner pharus b aunch river footman passed upon bridge wisely warily placed horseman armes together beast swam streame river much milder runneth crooked course others charged sodainely volley enemy shot auxiliary gone forth lightly appointed speedie footmanship island vnder wall plot whereof seated emperour riding warinesse circumspection began siege feare onely would drive townesmen mind making defence beene oft dealt withal way parle could man brought yeeld either promise threatnings began give assault environing wall three old circle course armed men first day night began maintained skirmish shot discharging peeces defendant whose courage strength behind spreading wide everie side bulwark large haireclothes keep violent force dart casting weapon fenced also shield wrought tough strong oysiers covered also thicke raw hide valiantly resisted made souldiors fierce gone citie saw void people fought sharpely townesmen citadell let flye shot castingweapons many sort defendant troubled sore brake crossebowes balists men also aloft set bowes strongly bent crooked horne whereof arising end stiffely bowed string driven violent stroke finger sent away shaft headed yron striking upon body stucke fast gave deadly wound neverthelesse skirmish held still side stormes stone flung hand thus doubtfull ballance enclining neither side conflict continued great resolution breake day shutting night gave even hand therefore morrow following fight speed commaunding engine named c helepolis built meanes whereof shewed king dem trius woon many townes therefore sirnamed poliorcetes huge frame like overtop battlement high tower defendant casting eye advisedly throughly considering besides firme resolution assailant suddaine fell prayer entreatie standing spred tower battlement wals stretched armes protesting openly romanes protection requested life pardon saw work given pioners attempting farther matter sure signe quietnesse rest required libertie conference ormisda obtained mamersides captaine garrison souldiors let rope sent unto emperour soone requested life impunitie himselfe consort upon assured covenant permitted returne unto reported done whole multitude sex one another wrought according mind upon peace concluded religious oathes gate set open went forth cry one voice saving genius andtutelar angell even caesar mightie mercifull prince shone heaven upon thus yeelded amounted number rest multitude suspecting siege aforehand embarked small vessel passing along river departed within citadell found great store armour victual winner taken sufficient serve owne turnes remaines burnt together place next morrow exploit atchieved heavie news came unto emperour leisurely peace taking repast namely surena persian tribu commaunder come unawares set upon three troupe part foreriders slaine among tribune laid along dead tooke away one banner forthwith moved great fit anger sped himselfe apace companie armes weapon hand hast made wrought safetie discomfited said brigand put shamefull foyle two tribune left alive cassed discharged militarie oath slouthfull lazie coward ten souldiors ran away condemned suffer death following herein lawes auncient discipline conclude citie hath beene sayd burnt downe standing upon tribunall raised purpose hee called together armie hee given thankes hee exhorted exploit like act thenceforth promised hundred silver e denier apeece perceiving chafed readie mutinie small niggardly promise himselfe growing also indignation yet full gravitie behold quoth persian flowing abundance plentie thing wealth nation able enrich u case one heart accord beare self manfully romane commonwealth trust truly infinite rich become exceeding poore even fill owne purse persuaded emperours returne home peace savage barbarous bought gold treasurie state hereby sore layed upon city drawne drie province wasted selfe neither wealth uphold kinred backe descended though noble parentage onely heart fearelesse neither shall shame emperour reposeth good furniture mind professe honest povertie fabricius also poore household good rich honour glorie managed dangerous warres thing may abundantly yee devoid feare demeane self mildly following wise guidance direction god selfe farre foorth humane reason doth require yee goe resist authoritie turning againe dishonourable president sedition old time goe hardly doe still part becommeth emperour noble commaunder run race performed many brave course alone die standing foot readie contemne life mine little fever bereave leastwise go wayes leave field lived may one day become private person howbeit glorie reioyce u approoved captaines tried leader kind martiall skill accomplished chap v persian practise meanes let hinderance iulian much adoe overcome found country commodious therein date tree strange report iulian armie refreshed commeth euphrates divided many branch neere unto maiozamalcha privily assailed ten persian notwithstanding great danger life escaped safetie modest speech emperours carrying current betweene courtesie severitie souldiors time appeased putting greater confidence expectation better matter promising tractable obedient extolled heaven authoritie highnesse spirit said truly heart love wont small noyse shewed declared returned againe tent according store present would affoord hee refreshed himselfe food rest night manner iulian animate armie swearing evermore thing deere unto great exploit affaire begun example might hee subdue persian might repaire shaken estate roman empire like reported traian otherwhiles hee woont bind word promise oathes may see dacia reduced forme province may passe ister euphrates upon bridge many like word say passed foureteene myles forward wee came certaine place abundant overflow water enricheth field maketh plentifull way persian informed would goe plucked floudgates suffered water flow spread abroad reason therefore ground stood standing poole second day emperour giving souldiors rest went forth himselfe many floored bridge made f leather bougets ship supported pyle also hewen log plankes date tree much difficultie transported armie country many field planted vine sundrie sort fruitfull tree date tree wont grow take great deale ground reaching manner mightie forrests farre adiabene botan castaldo mesene great mediterranean sea ortel levant sea according spaniard sea way soever man goeth seeth continually branch palmetrees date hanging thereupon fruit tree abovesaid made plentie honey wine touching date tree said maried wedded one another also sex may easily discerned reported moreover female annointed seed male doe conceive beare yea report delight mutuall love appeareth hereby doe bend head leane one another puffing blast wind turned another way case female according usuall manner besmeared seed male looseth abortive defect untimely fruit well knowne tree female love stocke stem besmeared ointment thereof tree naturally conceiveth sweet odour token bewrayed certainetie generation food armie replenished plentifully passed many island afraid want scarcitie feared fulnesse surfeit well emperour end assayled covertly enemy archer yet without revenge againe drew neere place greater part signes ill lucke sight whereof iulianus falling grievous fit indignation cryed sware iupiter would offer sacrifice unto mar neither hee ever sacrifice againe surprised soone speedie death hee debated romane carriage soone espied emperour returned wing lay supplie wee gone region came village named hucumbra two dayes space refreshed beside hope thing meet use gotten corne ynough departed presently rest save time would give u leave convey away consumed fire next day armie marched easily forward persian unwares set upon hindmost chaunce day charge rereward little adoe killed every one cavallerie neere hand intelligence hereof spred open wide valeyes repelled great danger wounding thus surprised skirmish slaine adaces noble peere kingdome beene sometime sent embassage emperour constantine away like discouraged whole armie whereupon emperour growing indignation good reason tooke guidons brake launce many proofe knowne fled enjoyned march among carriage packes truss captive leader onely fought manfully made captaine another troupe whose tribune convicted shamefully forsaken field fled moreover cassed also discharged militarie oath tribune certaine company horseman like foule cowardly part mild moderate allay temper correction considering difficulty danger toward emperour contented therefore journeyed forward seventie b stadium occasion grew scarcitie thing grasse corne burnt every man faine catch flaming fire keepe himselfe corne forage hee able carrie leaving therefore place also behind whole armie come certaine tract named maranga twylight somewhat day appeared infinite number persian together merenes generall horseman two king sonnes many potentate lord countrey band regiment harneised armor yron every part bodie covered close thick plate stiffe joint thereof meet knitting lims vizards men face curiously fitted head whereas body plated shot lighting upon could onely take hold sticke little hole full eye admit small sight tip nose narrow passage served wind breath readie serve pike stood firme kept ground man would thought bin fixed fast held chaines rope brasse hard marshalled archer feat whole nation cradle hath bin passing confident skill mightie practise thereof drew bent bowes armes wide asunder string came close right breast head arrow head lay upon left hand exceeding skill stroke finger shaft flew whistling singing sound carrying mischievous deadly wound placed elephant terrible sight beast glittering together grim cruell yawning mouthes fearefull minded men could hardly endure upon sat master carrying fast tied unto right armes knife haft bearing remembrance still defeature losse received nisibis unruly beast could restrained strength master feare least turning backe upon owne men fell hee might overthrow common souldiors mightie stroke made gash turning joint parteth head necke asunder experiment made asdruball brother anniball readie way dispatch beast bereave life seene without great terrour confident resolute emperour guarded round armed cohort principall captaines according extraordinarie puissance cruell force required arraunged band affront encounter enemie forme halfe moone crescent bowing winding side least archer running foorth might disray rankes company men advaunced forward banner speedily thereby brake violent force shot usuall manner given signall battaile romane footman standing thicke together preassing hard thrust backe thronged front enemy vaward medley grew hote sound shield clattering noyse also well men weapon making dolefull din among whome hoe stay hand field covered bloud slaine body lying along persian fell faster ground oftentimes faint conflict found great hinderance inconvenience close fight foot foot wonted otherwise beare valiantly afarre perceive time battailons give ground recule retyring toward backe manner shower stormes shoot arrowes streight fright enemy bold confident pursuit parthian therefore driven backe borne downe maine force souldiors outtoyled long time sweltered flaming heat sun sound given retreat returne againe tent emboldened good hand thenceforth attempt greater exploit battaile evident sayd slaughter persian great men small among variable chaunces fell conflict remarkable rest death veteranio brave warrior commaunded legion c zianni chap ii romane armie afflicted famine frugalitie iulian owne genius starre appeareth menacing manner unto truce appointed three day while every man busied curing owne wound fellowes destitute victual pinched hunger time intollerable much burning well forage corne men horse driven extremity provision food beast tribune lieutenant captaines comites carried great part dealt among meanest common souldiors extreame want verily emperour provided daintie eates king use light supper hee take little pillar tent hole small pittance thicke like hastie c gruell common etiam gregano base drudging souldior would disdaine eat looke whatsoever made readie service carelesse himselfe distributed sent away among poore needie souldiors himselfe drawne little take pensive repose betweene sleeping waking quite broken usuall matter sleep imitation iulius caesar wont write somewhat while lay campe passed dead time night musing meditating upon sentence certaine philosopher saw himselfe confessed inmost friend simple poore plight resemblance publicke genius mou ting imperiall diademe beheld gaule sad heavie wise cornu copia covered departing tapistrie hanging pavilion albeit present amazed strucken therewith astonied yet one stouping feare committed future event unto decree god heaven forsaking couch pallet lay upon ground risen midnight making supplication prayer unto god meanes certaine depulsorie sacrifice thought saw light burning flame like fell shoot along ayre vanish quite sight hereupon trembled quaked feare least planet mar appeared evidently menacing fierie bright meteore impression tearme nonlatin alphabet neyther fall time touch ground thinketh coelestiall body fall justly deemed prophane foolish person meteore apparition commeth many wayes shall suffice shew thinke sparkes set afire glowing vigorous heat skie able goe farre doe goe leastwise certaine flaming ray hitting thicke cloud quicke touch doe sparkle else light meeteth close joyneth cloud shaped like starre runneth course verily long held strength fire bodie thereof long way spacious passage emptied spent turneth exhalation going substance forcible rubbing fretting whereof caught heat streightwaies therefore ere day began tuscane wizard soothsayer sent asked judgement strange accident kind apparition starre portended answered wisely hee must beware forbeare attempt thing time shewing tarquitius bookes title de rebus divinis aphorisme set downe firelight seene skie ought battaile fought matter attempted despised warning also done many soothsayer besought would yet put journey houres could obtaine much crosse emperour readie withstand skill divination prophesie soone full day light dislodged removed campe forward chap iii next day iulianus raised stirred foile overthrow owne men while forgetting brigandine catching shield hasteneth battaile chaunced horseman staffe speare run rib while assaieth pluckeforth head hee fell horse battaile part lamentable brought backe campe sooner departed hence persian greatly feared steedie fight footman beene oftentimes beaten therwith laid amhushes closely accompanied u avoyding battailons either side lying espiall view march top high hill men suspecting much livelong day might neither cast rampier fortifie pallaisadoe thus verily while firmely guard side armie according site position ground marcheth six square battailons displayed large thin rankes word brought unto prince yet unarmed gone forth forward discover quarter sodainly behind gathering armour weapon together charge given backes accident much troubled catching hastily tumult shield forgetting corslet making hast helpe rereward called backe againe another new alarme whereby advertised avantguard also whence lately departed felt like distresse while without regard owne perill hec hasteneth recover set upright order againe another part companie parthyans couplet harneis setteth upon century maine battaile mids spredding fiercely left wing began alreadie shrinke while men could patience abide strong strength braying noyse elephant fought pike casting weapon discharged thicke prince setting spurres horse rode full carrier among dangerous skirmish went light armed company charging behind layd houx backe part well beast persian cut hacked iulianus forgetting looke himselfe lifting hand aloft cry alowd made evident demonstration disrayed fearefully scattered withall stirring anger followed chace engaged himselfe boldly farre battaile ida gallant follower feare disperkled cryed unto side decline huge multitude fled lesse fall ill framed disjoynted loover high building therewith sodaine horseman javelin whence came god knoweth slightly rippled skinne left arme pierced within short rib stucke fast neather lappet fillet liver while laboureth plucke forth right hand perceived sharpe edge thereof side sinewes finger cut thus falling forward horse head conveied backe campe present speedily came running meanes physicke chyrurgerie dressed cherished accordingly soone paine little assuaged gave feare great spirit striving death called horse armour end revising battaile againe hee might repaire confident hope owne men seeme rechlesse neglect himselfe wonderfully possessed care life preservation others shewing herein vigorous courage though case unlike epaminondas renowmed captaine wounded death mandigna mandi l un l mantinea returned battaile sought carefully shield hee saw neere unto died wound joyfully without feare forwent life afraid loose shield iulianus strength answerable flux bloud sore followed hee stood still stirred hereupon grew afterward past hope life inquirie made understood place hee fell called phrygia intelligence given aforetime written answer oracle even must dye prince brought againe pavilion man would beleeve heat souldiors enchaufed anger griefe hastened revenge rapping shield speares fully bent even dye case required although dust flew upon eye weather growing hot hindered agilitie bestirring limmes yet losse leader beene discharged othe freed militarie discipline ran desperatly without respect spare upon pike sword point side persian couragiously shot arrowes thick volley flight therof took away sunnes light opposing elephant withall going slowly big body thisaphalta sebaslianus procopius together tribune principall captaines souldiors committed charge defence mesopotamia solemne order required met u courteously received bare u companie prince made hast journey gladly seene nisibis pitched standing campe without citie earnestly requested many prayer people hee would enter citie custome prince lodge within palace stiffely refused abashed ashamed while conversed within wals citie otherwise expugnable delivered angrie enemy hand evening waxed darke iovianus principall secretary notary siege citie majozamalcha said escaped others mine ground violently taken supper brought place way pitched headlong drie pit overwhelmed number stone cast upon cause verily iulian slaine also nominated worthie empire creation iovianus behaved himselfe modest tearmes overheard whisper somewhat touching affayre while invited feast martiall men campe next day bine one persian said noble right honorable person among others making hast accomplish lord king commandement called instantly performance promise permission roman emperour entred citie set banner owne nation upon citadell denouncing unto citizen lamentable remove departure native seat presently commaunded flit gone stretched forth hand besought might imposed upon necessitie departing saying alone without publicke allowance victual souldiors able defend dwelling house trusting assuredly oftentimes found experience find justice hereafter also fighting place wherein borne wise verily state common humbly prayed spake vaine wind say while emperour made semblance fearing indeed thing declined hainous sinne perjurie sabinus man forwealth birth renowmed among fellow citizen burgesles rolling tongue owne made speech effect constantius world fierce cruell warres otherwhiles vanquished persian brought end flight hibita sure fenced station lived piece bread old woman countrey much entreatie reached unto yet lost none seignories dying day iovian first entrance empire hath parted wall province barre one would say whereof continued time mind without taking harme hee could prevaile while prince constantly pretended conscience keeping oath tooke received length much adoe constraint coronet presented unto good refused one silvanus advocate used plead defence men cause cry boldly alowd crowned quoth emperour mayest thou city bsides word hee grew angrie hee commaunded within three dayes depart wals detesting cursing present state time set certaine purpose force drive foorth threatening death also many delayed departure whereby citie full sorrow lamentation throughout street part thereof nothing heard groning wailing hand while matron readie thrust banished house wherein borne brought haire head while mother bereft buned child widdow husband driven away farre graf mane while lamentable multitude clipping post cheekes lintel entrie dores piteously wept hereupon sundrie wayes full departed every one could make shift many conveyed away stealth rich thought might handsomely caried setting nought rest household good wherof much great price left behind want labouring beast chap xiii iudgement ammianus marcellinus touching condition romane empire dayes corpes iulian enterred suburbian place neere tarsus armie commeth antioch seene many dreadfull sight namely comet touching reason nature whereof put downe naturall discourse place art thou fortune romane world justly blamed stormes blowing beating fore upon commonwealth diddest commit betake reynes helmethereof newly strucken hand skilfull leader pilot state unto raw young man come yet proofe knowne notable thing former life affaire right neither blamed commended one thing went heart good men while standeth feare concurrent while hee thinketh seriously upon gaule illyricum casteth mind many time aspired high matter making hast prevent fame comming pretense avoyding perjurie committed act unbeseeming emperour loosing nisibis ever since king mithridates dayes stood might maine east empire come possession persian never since citie rome first founded find suppose though read annales either consul emperour gave away right part territory triumphall honour ever conferred upon recoverie aught beene taken away enlarging dominion hence unto publius scipio regaining spaine unto fulvius capua skirmish assault made long time unto opimius diver battailes ended time fregellanes mortall enemy forced yeeld triumphes denied thus much also learned auncient record extreame case covenant made generall chief leader party side tooke expresse formall othe streightwayes making warie afresh undone voyd example old time streits gullet caudinae roman legion samnium put yoke also albinus numidia peace wickedly thought treated lastly mancinus author agreement made dishonourably hast delivered unto numantines well citizen fetched forth citie rendred constantius tribune sent assigne set garrison fort territory unto persian lord great captaines procopius sent reliques iulian interre suburb tarsus given charge life time taking journey execute businesse presently buried bodie departed neither could found although great diligence hee sought untill long seene constantinople suddaine invested purple robe matter wise brought journeyes thus dispatched came antioch many dayes together god beene offended seene many fearefull strange sight event whereof skilfull prodigial learning foretold prophecied would wofull lamentable statue maximian caesar stood verie porch entrie king house lost sodainly brasen ball fashioned forme heavenly globe pole carried also horrible noyse beames post within consistory made sound seene likewise daytime blazing starres touching nature whereof naturall philosopher varie much reason argument hold therefore called comet hairie starres multitude starres gathered together flashing fire certaine haires seeme scattered others opinion drie exhalation earth steeming aloft little little catch fire againe doe thinke rayes beames sunne kept going downeward opposition thicke cloud betweene casting brightnesse upon grosse bodie represent unto man eye light distinguished starres also thus conceited sight appeareth cloud drawne higher usually hath beene shineth reason vicinitie eternall heavenly fire leastwise certaine starres like unto rest rising setting whereof time bee appointed men wit could never reach unto much besides concerning bl ing starres comet read author learned astronomie may set downe pen maketh hast write matter chap xiiii iovianus commeth tarsus departed thence establisheth imperiall dignitie meanes within come far confines galatia bithynia hee night found dead vertues vice briefly touched emperour stayed pretie antioch sore troubled diver weightie care wonderfull desire gone therefore sparing neither beast man hee set forth thence verie mids cold winter notwithstanding hath beene sayd many ominous signes crossed entred tarsus noble citie cilicia originall foundation whereof shewed making exceeding great hast goe also appointed sepulchre iulian trimly garnished scituat within precinct way leadeth strait mountaine taurus whose reliques ash hee done right beene well advised c ra l cydnus seen pleasant cleere river though perpetuat glorie good deed tiberis runneth mids immortall citie rome toucheth monument auncient emperours sacred memorie passed tarsus departed tooke long journeyes came tyana town cappadocia procopius foresaid notarie memorius tribune returne meet open whole course proceeding beginning order required namely lucillianus entred millane seniauchus valentinian two tribune brought along knowing malarichus refused armes force mastership abovesaid rode post remes beene rumor quiet nation ranne forth use say without list verie unseasonably soone yet thing well setled ordinarie clerke gave himselfe auditor privie himselfe owne fraudulent naughtie dealing fled unto armie devised iulianus yet alive certaine man meane condition risen make alteration state himselfe emperour whose false deceitfull forgery souldiors mightily mooved growne tumultuous broyle slew lucillianus seniauchus valentinian soon became emperor great feare doubtful whither fly friend host primitivus packed away safetie upon heavie occurrent came newes joyfull namely souldiors sent iovinus hand militarie men use call caput scholarum brought tidings army serving gaule gladly embraced iovianus
