fought unfortunatly illyricum streight arinthe sent gaule bearing letter unto iovinus exhorting keepe place still remaine constant given also charge principall rayser foresaid tumult punished accordingly author sedition sent bound unto emperours court counsell matter disposed seemed expedient aspuna little enfranchised towne galatia souldiors serving gaule shewed unto emperour admitted yea revived bils writing debt long since buried therefore said procopius mounted tribunall reason people looked downe ground stood astonied silence gave suspition mischiefe toward supposing prepared thing minding take hold matter yet standing upon fearefull ticklish tearmes while maketh speed taketh great journeyes procopius earnest watchfull care day day spent whole night shewing abroad certaine suborned counterfeit person confident boldnesse faining come east others gaule brought word valentinian dead yea gave plaine tearmes lay cleare open new much favoured prince enter upon rebellious usurpation empire malapartly taken hand wont otherwhiles strengthened quick dispatch least thing omitted might strike terror forthwith nebridius newly faction petronius promoted rowme sallustius praefectus praetorio caesarius praefect citie constantinople cast prison layed fast phronemius commaundement rule citie wonted government euphrasius bee master office gaules men approved erudition learning managing militarie campeaffaires committed inconsiderately end shewed bewrayeth thing unto gomoarius agilo called backe againe take new oath souldiorie iulius captaine liuetenant come charge force thracia like neere station suppresse rebel understood attempt therefore feared effectuall cunning policie devised commaundement valens sent constantinople letter nebridius yet prison violently wrung colour treat trouble barbarous enemy detained strait hold close prisoner craftie deceitfull fetch warlike nation thracia without bloudshed woon side brought exceeding great aid maintenance tumultuarie attempt atchieved prosperous successe araxius also labouring palace procuring voice became praefectus praetorio agilo married daughter helped forward also good word many others likewise admitted sundry place employment court also administration province wils others owne accord offering money reward hand usually falleth civile domesticall dissentions diver rose even dunghill rascalitie directed onely desperate blind project contrariwise againe nobly borne fell high estate downe death exile like practises seemed faction firmely framed remained good store militarie force raised easily brought thing diverse time publicke broyles commotion hath hindered brave exploit enterprised even upon lawfull motif troupe company well horseman footman levied thracia performe expedition passed along courteously liberally entreated assembled together made shew armie gaping large promise paine cursed execration swore allegeance unto procopius promising behalfe constant resolution would faile defend owne armes force verily met fit occasion oportunitie allure unto part himselfe carrying owne armes little daughter constantius whose fresh memoriall highly honoured pretended kinred even iulian found also another thing suited verie fitly present time upon ornament imperiall vesture faustina mother said girle certaine meere chaunce present place adjoyneth another growne farre forth heavie issue could possibly one remained alive tell beene done souldiors standing resolute fierce courage quit well strength armes sore wounded foure thousand enemy left six acontisma hard lyeth vale arethusa station wherein seene sepulchre euripides poet famous loftie penning tragoedies also macra niceta stagria wee heard say aristotle borne tully sayth poureth river remained cruell battaile appius claudius proconsull utterly destroyed romane navy possessed townes standing upon bosphorus propontis came lucullus noble warrior conqueror place first others strucke hazard commonweale sixe province gained among first confineth afront upon illyrian speciall name called thracia adorned two spatious city philippopolis called old time eumolpias beroea next haemimontum hath hadrianopoli hadrianopolis called vscudama anchialo anchialos great city mysia standeth martianopolis surnamed traianus emperour sister also drista dristra dora dorostorus nicopoli city ap soph apris perinthus called also posteritie ensuing heraclea rhodopa annexed unto hath maximianopolis marogna soph maronea oeno nigr aenus aeneas built left wandering travailes long time perpetuall traine prosperous auspex arrived italie truth knowne continuall rumor time time bruited manner countrey people region aforesaid inhabite round high mountaines outgoe u health bodie certaine peculiar prerogative long life happeneth folke thinke hereupon abstaine feeding many meat together reason continuall freshnesse deaw cold sprinkling bindeth hardeneth body enjoy sweetnesse purer ayre besides first see sunne beames owne nature give maintaine life infected corruption earthly thing thus digested order matter returne began chap iiii valens reiecting frivolous excuse gothes maintained procopius side passed hister meeting none make resistance returneth force warre yeres ensuing renewed length gothes intercession athanaricus obtaine peace valens goeth backe constantinople procopius vanquished phrygia matter civile dissentions layed asleepe victor generall horseman sent unto gothes know plaine tearmes cause nation friend unto romanes obliged covenant free peace given aid armes unto one warred lawfull naturall prince might seeme first plea justifie deed presented unto letter procopius alledging tooke upon empire due unto neere kinsman constantine race avouching error worthie pardoned vpon knowledge whereof relation victor valens making small reckoning vaine excuse advaunced warlike manner foreknowledge alreadie trouble comming toward beginning spring assembled force together encamped neere unto strong hold named daphne upon bridge floored flankes hatch ship passed river hister without resistance made bearing himselfe aloft great boldnesse riding downe could find none might overcome terrifie men strucken feare souldiors approching brave shew preparation retyred mountaines accursius rendeth succi serri high inaccessible skilfull wayes least spent whole summer returne without exploit done sending arinibeus colonell footman certaine company wast spoyle seized part family came broken winding wayes might taken straggling wandering plaine field thus atchieved onely fortune presented hand returned force safetie neither given received grievous blow yeare following assayed like courage enter enemy land hindered streames w danubius overflowed farre beyond bank rested still pitching standing campeneere village named carporum untill end autumne whence nothing could done reason great flouds kept departed martianopolis winter semblably third yeare also holding purpose still broken ground barbarous enemy novidunum meanes shippes joyned together passe river continuall journeyes taken set upon grutungi warlicke nation inhabited light skirmish constrained feate extremitie athanaricus take flight dayes puissant ruler power thought sufficient dared make resistance himselfe force returned againe martianopolis keepe winter place tract meet convenient sundrie thing done emperour stayed manner modest wise while mounted thus exceeding high pitch power authoritie never considered himselfe well minded framed aright beseeming run rashly voluntarie delinquency hurt verie enemy nothing unreasonable high spirit pride soveraigne prince accompanied also bitternesse owne nature heliodorus wot whether sicknesse devised violence dead loth say much would god thing dangerous labor theodosius sparing none souldiors refreshed finer food cheered wage caprarienses abbannae neighbour light battaile defeated made hast burrough towne ense true messenger advertised barbarian alreadie possessed hill everie side winding mounted aloft passable none inborne inhabitant knew wayes verie well returne backe gave enemy good mean truce though lasted make stronger passing great ayds aethiopians neere adjoyning menacing noyse rushing whole plumpes without regard fight forced turne backe affrighted terrible sight inestimable troupe straightwayes taking heart againe returned bringing plentifull store victual men cast round ring shaking shield terrible kind gesture made head albeit therefore band furious enemy barbarian armour clattering one another making hideous fearefull kind noyse point give charge yea also knocked buckler knee yet like unto fabius maximus cunctator warie warriour politique souldior aforesaid distrusting small force boldly marching square delivered proclaimed open war whole nation upo joining cruel battaile barbarian beyond al measure braved behaved fiercely opposed battaile shaped round fashion forcible violence mightie troupe people yeelded promising voluntarily furnish aidsouldiors victual chap xiiii firmus returned isaflenses theodosius goeth meet small power setteth upon enemy end doubtfull battaile discomfiteth foileth done courseth isaflenses firmus despaire himselfe endeth life halter whereby province recovered quietnesse like glorious atchievements noble captain taking great joy contentment puissant power sought meet principall troubler himselfe peace therefore making abode long time neere fort named medianum many politicke debatements mean projected good hope might betrayed unto while perplexed thought deepe care forecast compasse understood truth enemie returned isaflenses without farther delay marched speed vnto king named igmazen prince tract high reputation famous wealth advancing forth boldly affronting whence art thou quoth businesse hast thou thou art hither come answere vpon theodosius resolute mind looking wistly sterne countenance lieutenant sayth unto valentinian lord whole earth sent subdue bloudie cruell robber unlesse thou render hand according invincible emperour hath determined thou whole nation thou rulest shall utterly perish igmazen heard many reviling taunt let flie generall much troubled anger griefe together went way next morning betimes army side advanced forth menacing wise readie encounter joyne battaile barbarian side neere marshalled front vantguard behind whose backes bestowed secretly squadron auxiliary supply rising little little might shew multitude enclose men ere aware besides came many iesalenes aidsouldiors shewed promised men helpe provision victual side roman although yet bearing valiant heart lifted precedent victory set flank thicke thrust together fitted shield close one another manner fenceroufe stood ground resisted sunne rising unto end day fight continued firmus little evening seene mounted upon tall courser displaying forth good way red coat armor lowd cry move exhort souldiors deliver theodosius betimes tearming cruel detestable bloudy deviser torment execution case desirous rid extremity endured word unlooked incited eagerly fight inticed others forsake field therefore soone still time night come while side enwrapped within wandering darknesse roman generall returned fortresse duodiense taking review muster souldiors looke many cowardly feare word beside firmus turned purpose fighting punished sundry way death cutting right hand others burning alive carefully keeping watch ward barbarian adventured moone downe could seene set upon campe either discomfited else rushed audaciously took prisoner departing thence great pace coursed iesalenes people hardly trusted crooked lane little looked afflicted brought extreame penurie returned townes mauritania caesariensis sitifis racked tortured even death castor martinianus partaker romanus robbery foule fact burnt warre began afresh isaflenses first conflict many barbarian beaten backe slaine igmazen king heretofore wont ever winner distracted terrified present distresse supposing beare himselfe obstinately still commerce traffique prohibited remained hope live warily closely possibly could battaile brake foorth alone espying theodosius humbly besought commaund masilla chiefe peere mazices come unto sent request secret conference advised generall owne disposition starter constant resolute give mean wherby might bring easily purpose would preasse hotly upo owne nation continuance fight turne feare verily readie ynough affect favour rebell wearied many loss theodosius gave eare condiscended word often skirmishing foyled isaflenses while fell downe like many beast firmus privily slipped aside whe bin confined long time within starting hole way while consulted flie escape staied kept ward igmazen much informed bin underhand secretly practised masilla seeing extremitie despaire estate remedie left one determined voluntarie death tread foot desire life nonce full wine till skin strutted againe himselfe lay awake terror miserie hanging head while warder load likewise headie wine lay sound asleepe dead time night leaving bed creeping foure without making noise severed himselfe apart farre found cord end life happened readie hand hung upon nayle spike stucke wall knitting necke within without lingering torment ended life accident igmazen taking grievously groning againe disappointed glory good hap lead rebellious enemie bond romane campe assurance made safe conduct meanes masilla himselfe carrying dead bodie thus murthered upon camell approched tent armie pitched sort subicarense shifted upon packehorse presented unto theodosius joyed triumphed thereat calling together well armed souldiors common people asked whether knew visage without delay circumstance made understood certainely face remained little returned sitifis triumphant manner received solemnly favour sort age degree chap xv valentinian warreth upon quadi whose king gabinius wicked plot maximinus murthered while theodosius generall aforesaid thus painefully employed within mauritania africke warres markfelders aventin quadi rose armes upon suddaine nation little feared wonderfull warlike puissant time speedie exploit doe shew people thern dubra io marcomanni aquileia suddaine besieged long time od iso leandro opitergium raced many bloudie exploit performed quicke dispatch while mauricus maricus principall spoken breaking alpes iuliae hardly able withstand truth barbarian cause quarrell complain valentinian burning desire glorious must need say generous excessive immoderat beginning empire fortifie limit commanded garrison castle built beyond river hister upon verylands quadi bin already roman jurisdiction whereat inhabitant much discontented wisely looking main chance farre forth might partly embassage partly secret murmuring hindered time maximinus greedily set upon mischiefe able mitigate inbred humor pride puffed praefectship blamed rebuked equitius magistrum armorum con stabile remigius florentius taketh generall force time throughout illyricum one obstinate headie slothfull said worke yet finished appointed goe forward expedition said moreover one tendering common good parvo suo little son marcellianus made ducis lord marcher generall force valeria fort would erected without ado allegation contrarie soone came passe accordingly promoted place commaund sooner gone forth arrived part swelling pride unreasonably ut filius sonne right without winning talke conference fained furmises desire designe never attempted caused avoid owne country setteth hand worke little begun meanes entreatie graunted forelet time last king gabinius modest tearmes required might new alteration marcellianus semblance courtesie would condiscend unto invited others feast departure good cheare while feared harme breaking wickedly religious bond hospitalitie caused murthered rumor whose horrible fact incontinently spread abroad diver wayes set quadi nation seated round rage bewailing king death home number cattell sundrie sort verily time like happened inexpiable mischiefe reckoned among dishonourable loss romane state went within little daughter constantius taking repast certaine mannor call vi rici lazio pistrensis time shee brought wedded unto gratianus beene taken prisoner faire grace god messala governour province present mounted swift postchariot maine pace rode away brought backe sirmium six twentie myles thence good fortunate hap royall virgine damosell delivered danger miserable servitude whose captivitie unlesse might ransomed would surely brought much miserie upon way mirth make notarie laughing fellow cried sayd make emperor thou wouldest hand meere jeast untowardly wrong sence expounded cost faustinus himselfe nigrinus also others life proceed merobaudes sent warlike power footman whereof conduct wast burne barbarian territory joyned commission lieutenant sebastian valentinian removed campe forward neere petro varadin nigr acincum set ship together suddaine chance might befall quicke speed might planked manner bridge passed another way countrey quadi lay verily espiall waiting comming high craggie mountaines whither part countrey uncertaine doubtfull accident would happen together wife child liefe deare unto retyred altogether amazed astonied contrarie expectation saw emperours ensignes displayed within countrey therefore advaunced forward forced pace occasion served killed people age indifferently one another stragled abroad suddaine rode surprised also burnt house returned safetie led forth like sort made abode aciencum latter end autumne sought convenient wintering harbour along tract wont frozen coldnesse weather neither could meet convenient seat stain stainam angern sabaria although place time strength continuall calamity time time sore afflicted whereupon aboundoning towne although great importance thence removed lustily coasted along river banke fortified castle fort competent garrison came bregnir bregitio fatall destinie framed long agoe prince rest denounced unto last end many prodigie betokening dayes blazing starres burned forth commonly forerunner fall prince originall cause whereof declared alreadie sirmium lightening suddaine clap thunder shot cloud set fire part c ri counsellhouse palace likewise sabaria while himselfe yet remained owle sitting upon top king baines singing dolefull note could expert hand shot arrowes flung stone made fall albeit layd hard striving vie feat semblably citie afore side marched give battell would need goe forth gate entred end might gather good presage speedie returne backe againe gaule also place lay forelet neglected heapes rammell therein scoured made cleane yron dore happened fall downe made fast passage multitude people laying power strength thereto able remove spent day thereabout vain upon constraint faine goe another gate night went next day bereave life saw men commonly doe sleepe wife absent sitting haire loose eares clad poore mournefull array imagined esteemed owne fortune readie depart foule attire habite setting forward thence morning betimes somewhat sad frowning countenance horse brought unto would suffer get backe contrarie manner rose forefoot aloft inbred crueltie soone nature fell commaunded right hand souldior yeoman stirrop cut put beside readie mount accustomed beast died dolorous manner innocent young man cerealis tribune stable danger himselfe put deserred cursed act came embassadours quadi humble wise requesting pardon finall abolishing past might obtaine without barre impeachment promised young trained souldiors behoofefull thing also romane state thought good receive entertaine yea suffer returne graunt truce required longer trouble molest neither want victual adverse time yeare would emperour contemned basenesse meane condition embassadours requiring better sort sufficient person sent ratifie confirme article agreed upon meane purpose held trifled time end fraudulent cessation armes horseman might returne hoped would shortly become souldiors enchafed heat summer drie chawes might become faint heartlesse considering field wide large shone fire enemy set burning wood drie fuell put purpose beside fell another mischiefe also namely men beast grievously distressed hunger mean time helpe matter well fritigernus one wisely could guesse cast might fearing doubtfull fortune warre sent upon owne head one common sort herault treat peace craving certain nobilitie elect person forthwith sent unto hostage himselfe resolved without feare abide violence souldiors necessarie consequents therof project motion dread prince commander commended approved equitius tribune charge committed unto palace kinsman valens assent every man appointed speed go pledge denied goe taken prisoner enemy broken made escape dibaltum regard whereof feared unreasonable passion richomeres owne accord offered goe willingly promised much thinking also brave act beseeming valiant man forward went minding shew good token dignitie noble parentage going toward enemy fort archer targuetiers one baturius iberian charge together cassio violent heat adventured engage forward farre joyne skirmish adversary brake soone time cowardly reculing dishonored beginning battaile thus impeachment occasioned unseasonable attempt cheerefull forward service richomeres abated considering permitted go gothes horseman time returned alatheus safrages together power alemans intermingled among sent like lightening thunderbolt shot high mountaines whomsoever could swift rodes meet quickly discomfited slew chap xiiii army gothes romanes embattailed sharpe conflict length romanes put flight touching death valens twofold opinion thinke killed arrow never seene others consumed fire every side fell shake armor weapon bellona blew dolefull lamentable blast trumpet men began give ground cry many unto made head resisted verily fight manner flashing flame affrighted even stout heart souldiors wistly beheld thrust whirling shot dart arrowes army buckling dashing one another like unto ship pointed beakhead pike brasse thrusting one another turnes reciprocall alternative motion wave sea driven fro best wing romanes horseman come farre verie wagon readie advance farther seconded succoured forsaken cavallerie beside enemy number pressed upon like great rampier fortification fallen borne downe disrayed footman wanting defence flankes stood plump company thrust thronged together beene clunged one could either draw sword bring backe hand time dust raised man able see sky resounding horrible cry shout reason castingweapons discharged everie way missed ever fell gave deadly stroke mischiefe venue could neither foreseene avoided barbarian rushing still huge multitude overthrew horse man together considering rankes men stood close together could place roome made retire enemy likewise thicke thrust together meanes make way escape souldiors also setting light utmost extremitie death tooke againe sword full butt running upon hewed peeces withall maine blowes dealt fro ax headpeeces habergeon slat dashed peeces might man seene stout stomacked barbarian teeth gnashed set head hammestrings cut right hand smitten sword side thrust even readie give last gaspe yet menacing wise looke round sterne terryble eye thus reason body side fought pell mell laid along ground field covered slaine great horrour heard grievous grones men either dying else shot bodie deepe wound great confused tumult footman toyle daungers cleane spent afterwards strength failed wit would serve devise counsell javelin continuall thrusting knocking together broken asunder contenting drawne sword engaged thickest troupe enemy men unmindfull saving seeing mean left escape refuge ground standing lake bloud slipperie underfoot overturned went endevoured could sell life deere dye unrevenged great courage stoutnesse opposing preased hard upon dyed even upon owne weapon length overspred confused shew nothing blacke bloud way soever one turned eye lay heapes men slaine without spare trampled dead carkasses withall heat sunne mounted great height passed leo course house celestiall signe virgo overcame roman besides weakened hunger undone verie thirst heavie armour also weigh downe conclude barbarian charged still maine force battailons discomfited great disorder tooke heeles onely helpe desperat extremitie fled every man way could while thus dispersed blind lane make shift gone emperour beset one would say round horrible fearfull sight little little mounting heap dead body betooke himselfe f lancearij g mattiarij violent number enemy abidden stood ground still body sound unshaken traianus saw crieth hope ever past gone unlesse emperour thus forsaken owne guard squire might length protected aid stranger captaine named victor heard hastening speed assemble h batavi bestowed farre succour helpe pinch defence guard emperours person could meet none retyred backe departed like manner richomeres saturninus made shift escaped danger barbarian therefore furious rage sparkled even verie eye followed hard chace upon men verie heat veines readie melt faint againe fell knew smoat others againe overwhelmed prease onely coursed dyed upon owne fellowes hand neither lightly yeelding strove againe one spared yeelded besides many lying halfe dead able endure smart torment wound stopped verie wayes also corp slain hudled heap together filled field carkasses wel loss never amends made cost romanes deere night without moonelight made end began darke emperour among common souldiours probably thought man ever directly said saw thing mortally wounded arrow fell presently thereupon yeelded vitall breath departed neither ever found occasion enemy tooke lodging love would spoile dead none either men put flight inhabitant hard durst goe unto place like wofull case befell heard say unto decius caesar manfully fighting barbarian chaunced fall horse full spirit courage could hold flung bog moore could neither ryse againe ever found others say valens yeelded ghost presently gallant guelded eunuch brought back countrey cottage hard made workmanly strong two lo t story aeneid stately verse likewise called hexametre consisteth six foot f pythici verse oracle delivered called pythius one sirnames apollo rendered answeres consulted oracle whereupon also named nonlatin alphabet priestresses pythiae strab lib g branchidae priest apollo didymaeus strab lib h olympicke game see little syrenes meremaids may read homer odyss lib vlysses passed sicilian sea stopped eares companion wax caused himselfe fast tied unto mast ship allured sweet melodie k areopagite counsell court justice athens severe upright instituted cecrops first eusebius thinketh solon reason name twofold either passed court triall judgement bloudshed murther expressed name mar greeke are mar judicially accused neptune killing sonne halirrhotius stucke downe speare hereof fabulous concertation barre god may read carol sigon de rep atheniens lib cap l seven vowel meaneth greeke nonlatin alphabet pliny writeth paine stomacke next unto strangurie occasioned stone intollerable whether meaneth physician tearme cardialgiam ileos otherwise called volvulus iliaca passio domine miserere mei although originally seated small higher gut yet vicinitie soone affecteth stomack appeareth dolorous vomiting rather disease symptome cholera wherein stomake painefully affected dischargeth selfe upward downeward cannot determine kk whereas booke cap valentinian said kept two shee beares one named innocentia mica aurea golden mica probable former name also alluded mica name woman call mind therefore plutarch moral among praiseworthie woman th e large narration one damosell daughter philodemus elean named mica read micca licentious reigne aristotemus tyrant one lucius enamoured upon much courting solliciting forfeit honor bodie vaine killed sight bosome father whose guilded image set memoriall rome conjecture pancirolus l master forge wherein armour made see certaine officer belonging emperours stable called stratores chuse allow horse meet service l constantiani band souldiors erected constantius emperor lerna lerne mere territorie argo serpent hydra haunted much mischiefe countrey whereinto also used cast filth c whence came proverbe lerna malorum sinke sinne mischiefe others tertullian taxeth absurd edict emperour wise prohibiteth enquirie innocent yet commaundeth punished offendors spareth cruell fareth dissimuleth yet chastiseth c name saith hee christian condemned punished wicked act name onely hurtfull men themselues harmelesse p ap annius trebonius gallus atilius metilius bradua evaristus bishop church rome professing christ suffereth death p cornelius palma second time c caluisus tullus second time ignatius bishop antioch condemned rome exposed unto sauage beast euseb p clodius crispinus solenus orphitus mighty earthquake dio describeth large shaketh citie antioch c calpurnius piso vettius rusticus bolanus time traian hauing expelled cosroes held yeres kingdome parthian reduced dacia scythia syria armenia assyria mesopotamia forme praefectus praetorio highest officer estate invested sword hee said sword thou shalt draw long rule justly shall rule unjustly draw hardly upon hee first stranger alien borne italie made emperour used familiaritie plutarch empire demeaned himselfe well unto new created emperour acclamation went note happy augustus honest traianus among many excellent saying eutropius recordeth unto friend seeming blame ouer courteous men answered thus emperour priuat person would wish emperours unto selfe priuat succeeded p imper caesar traian hadrianvs aug p max co iii emperor reigned yeres moneths dayes dion without crime committed held guilty condemned name sect sake onely wherewith hadrian moved wrote unto minutius fundanus proconsul asia christian condemned without enditement crime proued copie letter remaineth extant day euseb lib p gallicanus coelius titianus lampridius life seuerus writeth hadrian minded build temple unto christ commanded use christian church founded erected city without image prohibited stayed said done men would forsake temple god embrace christian religion p l nonius asprerias asprenas torquatus annius libo time flourished aquila ponticus translated bible holy scripture governour iudaea killeth great number iewes iosip many christian soldiors christian faith suffer death rome eu p q fabius catullinus flavius apet barcozba prince iewes counterfait messias haleth execution christian perseuere faith euseb lib cap citie hadrianopolis built niceph lib ca p ser octavius lena pontianus antonius rufinus furious tumult outrage iewes increase syria palestina assembling themselues together infinite number promising themselues exceeding great victorie leading barcozba mockmessias dio euseb barcozba otherwise named barcochab sonne starre termed himselfe deceiued credulous iewes expounded prophesie himselfe iacob shall arise starre p serius augurinus arrius severianus last warre iewes hadrianus iewes revolting openly roman taking armes spoile waste palestina vnto tinius rufus governour province hadrian sendeth armie sub due rebells dangerous long warre continuing three yeares while iewes take heart forraine nation came inhabite city ierusalem first roman made small accompt understood iewry iewes wheresoever dispersed hadrian sent expert valiant captaines dio euseb p heberus iulius silanus sesennius barcozba barcochab aforesaid onely adjoyned unto iewes went also draw christian societie warre roman therefore many christian refused service put sundry torment kindes execution p c iulius servilius vrsus servianus c vibius iuve tiu verus iulius serverus sent iewrie daring fight audacious desperat brigand drew warre length meane power force barcochab confirmed certaine yeares held within iewrie castels village bethoron towne right strongly fenced p pompeianus lupercus l iulius atticus acilianus whith towne sallied upon roman oftentimes put flight whereupon hadrianus returned syria besieged iewes three yeares together forced bethoron length slew barcozba p l ceionius commodus verus afterward called caesar sex vetulenus ciuita pompeianus number report iewes slaine warre died pestilence famine innumerable note way iewes thus defeated leader slaine knew counterfait false messias whereupon termed bencozban sonne lying hadrian thus ended iewes warre subdewed debarred iewes entrance ierusalem walled city called aelia owne name upon gate leadeth bethlehem hee caused swine marble engraven last utmost destruction iewes expelled utterly oppressed hee granted ierusalem unto christian euseb lib cap dio hadrian thus prophefie daniel yeeres fulfilled might iewes see hope messias come quite cut upon desolation rooting began church christ flourish c say ierusalem inhabited christian nation according saying saviour luke ierusalem shall bee troden foote gentile computation yeeres destruction falleth bee hundred yeeres suffering christ upon crosse yeere former destruction titus fulfilled crie blood upon u child moreover hadrian made law none iewish nation hardy enter territorie ierusalem prophesie saviour fulfilled shall remaine one stone upon another c iewes taken prisoner warre hadrian sent away spaine live exile whence also yeere lord expelled ferdinandus king spaine emanuell portugall vasaeus p l aelius sonne hadrian august verus caesar second time yet al ceased persecution christian christian absolved accuser suffer due punishment euseb antoninus alleageth edict hadrian word favour men christian governours also province wrote time unto father sacred memorie wrote backe againe man anicetus bishop rome polycarpus disciple iohn apostle came rome reduced many bin seduced heretickes unto true faith hee sharpely great courage repressed marcion euseb lib irenaus affirmeth youth hee seene polycarpus aged man faith heard polycarpus say saint iohn disciple lord going bath hee saw cerinthus within leapt foorth bain hee bathed saying withall feared left house would fallen while cerinthus enemie trueth within polycarpus himselfe meeting upon time cerinthus hee said take knowledge acquaintance u returned answer knowe thee indeede first begotten sonne satan irenaeus lib p plautius quinctillus statius priscus antoninus emperour wealthie estate owne inheritance gave away liberally rich among friend made common treasury exceeding rich euseb p vibius barus ap annius bradua fortunately armenia avidius cassius nartius verus marched puislant armie farre babylonia armenia seleucia noble citie assyria men hee wonne hee brought backewith parthick triumph together antoninus killed euseb lib blandina middes torture cried ever anone christian refreshed selfe endure warre marcomanni whereunto emperours addressed reason pestilence staied good capitolin p l vettitus paulus iunius montanus persecution church continueth eusebius expedition marcomans emperours come aquileia certaine prince intreated pardon peace capitolin p sosius priscus q caelius apollinaris lucius aurelius verus journey citie concordia altinum sitting together antoninus philosophus chariot died apoplexie man nature nothing civile howbeit reverent regard companion empire never attempted forcible act eutropius writeth died eleventh yeere empire chronographers thinke otherwise followed decease antoninus philosophus ruled alone capit p aurelius severus ethegus l iulius clarus avidius cassius nominated east emperor presently souldiers beheaded spart vulcat gall p titienus serenus c scoedius natta pinari egesippus lived accompted famous writer ecclesiasticall historie church still flourisheth crosse p claudius maximus cornelius scipio orfitus dame felicitas hir seven son rome concordius elder church spoletum became martyr asianus apollinaris present apology unto antoninus whole world afflicted great mortalitie roman army consumed therewith almost last man german made insurrection repressed euseb niceph capitolin p aurelius severus time ti claudius pompeianus franticke heresie montanus spread church eclesiast histor marcomans war none hath bin recorded great singualr prowesse felicitie antoninus philosophus dispatched brought end whereof may reade oros li ca iul capitol eutrop eu lib tertullian cap apologet others p ap annius trebonius gallus flaccus notable victorie antoninus philosophus emperour quadi marcomanni obtained prayer christian souldiers army antoninus distressed five day together want water souldiers within streights certaine mountaines germanie inclosed round quadi maner killed thirst praefect praetorium came unto emperor great agony sore appauled saying christian praier could obtaine thing hads god antoninus hearing requested pray unto god done kneeling bare ground powring foorth praiers christ sodainely powred downe also heauen aboundance raine wherewith roman receiving water partly mouthes partly shield refreshed contrariwise quadi nation germany haunted lightning oros capitolin euseb tertull emperour amazed great miracle highly honoured christian souldiours mitigated rigor persecution named legion christian euer lasting memoriall thereof greeke nonlatin alphabet fulminatrix thus meanes christian quadi vanquished extant yet letter marcus emperor wherein layeth open matter senate rome testifieth heavenly benefit ascribed unto praiers christian credible saith christian howsoever accompt impious god breast defence sooner cast theselves upon groud offred praiers god unto unknowne presently fell fro heaven cold raine u enimies haile lightning vnto praiers god presently assistant cannot vanquished therfore let u grant unto person may christian lest procure u praier dart confound u p calpurnius piso salvius iulianus enemy thus subdued antoninus philosophus delivereth pannonia servitude eutrop p vitrasius pollio secod time flavius second time antoninvs triumpheth againe rome sonne commodus antoninus made caesar eutrop lamprid iul capitolin common treasure warre wasted marcus two month together sold port sale forum hall traianus furniture stuffe belonged owne private estate triumph gaue backe money againe many would restore said good bought neither molested hee chose rather keepe still bought publike feasting cheered people likewise shews publike sight report exhibited hundred horse shewplace eutrop p imp caesar l aurelius commodus augustus plantius quinctilius severus praetor elect governeth well spaine spartianus irenaeus bishop lion wrote heretickes bookes yet extant euseb time also irenaeus himselfe witnesseth second booke heresy gift casting devills evill spirites healing continued still tertullian maketh mention irenaeus nameth curious exact examiner searcher kindes learning p vettius rufus p cornelius scipio orfitus p l aurelius co modus augustus second time vespronius candidus verus persecutor heretickes overcome patience christian godly erudition learning bishop ecclesiast hist p bruttius praesens second time sex quinctilius gordianus marcus antoninus philosophus dieth day aprill yeere age tertullian noteth lived age onuphr hee left unto world great misse present posteritie perpetuall memorie vertue happy beene capitolinus writeth left sonne behinde yet tooke hee order excellently well brought instructed hence roman storie proceedeth golden age yron sodaine change commodus roman empire yeere beginneth dio story wherein relateth fiftie yeeres space himselfe eiewitnesse yeere antoninus death beginneth herodian storie holdeth yeeres namely yeere lord whereas herodian saith wrote actes yeeres happly hee compriseth therein yeeres antoninus philosophus whereof eiewitnesse succeeded avrelivs commodvs antoninvs nineteenth emperour nineteene yeeres age ruled twelve yeeres eight moneths fifteene day nothing resembled father person also fought fortunately german rigor cruelty even another domitian silthy unbridled lust another nero taking pleasure bloody exercise swordplayers monster shape man dio lamprid herodian dio writeth martia concubine commodus kept well affected christian might doe much commodus conferred many benefit favour upon p aurelius commodus august third time antistius burrhus temple serapis alexandria burnt eusebius little smyrna citie asia fell earthquake euseb commodus triumpheth german yet fully subdued herodian p petronius mamertinus vettius stlavius albinus trellius rufus among many hinderance occasioned tyranny commodus yet pantaeus erected kept famous schoole christian alexandria came doctours many church scholer anteus clemens alexandrinus whose workes entituled stromaton read day euseb p imp commodus fourth time aufidius victorinus p eggius marcellus n papirius aelianus baines commodus built exceeding great charge p triarius maternus atilius metilius bradua origen yere borne alexandria flourished many famous doctours church ecclesiast hist p imp comodus fift time acilius glabrio perennius prefect bloody minister cruell lord wicked devise entrappeth many nobilitie killeth lamprid herodian p clodius crispinus papirius aelianus capitoll rome smitten lightning great sire occasioned thereby renowmed librarie house neere adjoyning burnt lamprid herodian diver synod bishop holden easter day while church hath little rest persecution minister thereof fell jarres brawles ecclesiast hist p c allius fuscianus dullius silanus perennius torne peeces souldiers succeeded cleander notable sycophant court domitian put death great famine rome lamprid herodian apollonius senator rome read unto senate booke written true religion christian faith lost head euseb lib p iuuius silanus q servilius silanus commodus tooke away head colosse caused head owne image set thereupon hee would needes stiled hercules god lamprid cassiodor p imp commodus sixt time petronius septimianus iewes thalmud written seder olam p cassius apronianus atilius mesilius bradua second time happened rome great scarrefire whereby palace temple vesta part citie laid even ground among many calamity victor bishop rome busieth troubleth east church easter day ecclesiast hist p imper commodus seuenth time helvius pertinax second time afterwards called augustus commodus incommodious men strangled night went kalends ianuarie newyeeres day hee lived yeeres moneths lamprid dio herodian prince lived nothing mischiefe subject owne shame lamprid heere clemens alexandrinus endeth supputation time dread senate people rome raigned seuenteene yeeres eight moneths three day emperour dome senate either hee never beene borne never died seemed cruel exceeding profitable commonweale dio spartian scapula sheweth president province persecuted christian went away cleere unpunished also severus himselfe favoured christian cyprian ierome witnesseth catalogue attributed much unto tertullian writing whensoever called booke thereof usually said unto clerke notarie give hither master meaning tertullian p aurelius antoninus third time p septimius geta second time p ti claudius pompeianus lollianus nine moneths twentie five day vnto sonnes much deerer subject vpon deathbed said unto sonnes agree together enrich souldiers despise others dio prince good fortune base condition office learning parthian suspected harme tooke friend king sonne lawe put great number parthian sword herodian antoninus caracalla hee polluted himselfe blood many excellent men slaine day aprill yeere age dio spartianus writeth mid way carrae edessa time went warre upon parthian stabbed dagger servitor mounted horse backe mean traine macrinus praefect praetorium plotted entred upon empire caracalla saith dio never thought good himselfe confessed never knew goodnes caracalla succeeded opilivs macrinvs emperor reigned one yeere one moneth day eutrop iul capitolin pm opelius antoninus diadumenus caesar enthralled lust filthinesse demeaned himselfe woman like woman became wedded unto men teacher minister lewd wicked act advanced honour while meane time hee thrust downe murdred excellent person rust cu cornelianus maximinus emperour yeere age together sonne murdered owne souldiers aquileia dead body shamefull reprochfull maner cast open streetes left devoured dogges foules head pitched upon pole sent rome yeelded pleasant spectacle unto men last people leaping joy burnt campus martius sonne maximinus killed crie set bad kinde ought besaved much whelpe saieth capitolinus cruell beast lived upon face earth confidence hee owne strength hee thought hee could possibly bee killed goodly greatnesse bodie beleeved maner immortall stepped one theater even presence pronounced certaine greeke verse effect cannot killed one killed many elephant bigge yet killed lion strong yet killed tigre strong yet killed take heede many together thou feare none severally p two gordians father sonne armie affrike made emperours day retained life dignitie vanquished slaine capellianus prefect moore death knowne senate rome created pvpienvs maximvs balbinvs emperours new name stiled eathers senate reigned together one yeere herodian capitolin happened great eclipse sunne darke noone day midnight neither could thing done without candle light capitolin p vlpius crinitus c nonius proculus pontianus pupienus maximus balbinus rome praetorian souldiers killed time capitoline game herodian succeeded antonivs gordianvs yonger yeere styled caesar reigned sixe yeeres saying miserable emperour true report kept capitolinus p imp anton gordianus acilius aviola sabinianus africke raiseth sedition rebellion gordianus gordianus praefect mauritania forceth yeeld capitolin p vettius sabinus second time venustus p imp marc anton gordianus second time claudius pompeianus persian warre gordianus espouseth daughter misitheus learned wiseman whose valiant service politicke counsell persian warre good proofe capitolin p c aufidius vettius atticus c asinius praetextatus gordianus openeth temple ianus marcheth persian vanquisheth sapor king persian regaineth many city capitolin eutropius happened great earthquake itswallowed many city inhabitant capitolin pc iulius apriauus aemilius papus misitheus praefect praetorium dieth whose place ordained philippus arab forgetfull benefit received gordianus attempted wicked cursed devise hoist emperiall seate capitoliu argunthis king scythian wasteth border roman empire capitolin p pereg inus fulvius ae ilianu p gordian souldiers slaine moneth march ivlivs philippvs arab governed emperor together philippvs son yeeres certaine moneths eutrop victor philippus arab first roman christian emperour eusebius reporteth easter day bishop would admit lord supper among others confessing sinnes hee stood church shewed token repentance p imp mare iulius philippus fabius titianus new heresy sprung arabia origen suppressed spreading solemnity yeere following third consulship philippvs touching celebrity sport see capitolinus p imp iulius philippus third time sonne philippus caesar second time p fulvius ae ilianus vettius aquilinus philip emperours souldiers killed succeeded gn messivs quinctvs traianvs decivs reigned sonne decivs caesar two yeeres certaine moneths parthian invade armenia possesse put tyridates king flight taken sonnes hand upon submission pomp laetus p imp traianus decius august second time maximus gratus p seventh persecution christian set foote decivs like unto cruell tempest swallowed drowned many holy men saint sundry place among fabian bishop rome laurence whose constant faith shining among flame hee lay upon gredyron prudentius depainteth life babylas bishop antioch also apollonia virgine teeth strucken head leapt owne accord flaming fire made consumed ash ecclesiast hist schisme novatians troubleth church dionysius bishop alexandria reporteth eusebius chaeremon bishop aged togither wife fled unto mountaine arabia never seen notwithstanding brother sought wife diver time yet could never find body whereupon guessed taken alive heaven p imp traiantis decius third time q herennius hetruscus decius caesar decius warre gothes whole armie defeated bodie swallowed deepe whirlepit quavemire could found battaile sonne decius slaine iornand cassiodor orosius eutrop pestilent disease raigneth diverse province world plagueth alexandria aegypt throughout valens lvcinianvs usurpeth empire sext aurel victor decij succeed c vibivs treboni anvs gallvs caivs vibivs volvsianvs reigned full two yeeres euseb eutrop vnder emperours people rome beganne first pay yeerely tribute unto forraine barbarous nation pomp laetus blondus p c vib trebon gallus august second time c ib volusianus august aemilius maurus usurpeth empire within little perished pomp laetus p c vib volusianu august second time valerius maximus two emperours gallvs volvsianvs slaine succeeded valerianvs gallienvs reigned yeeres whose life trebellius pollio hath described origen ecclesiasticall writer departed life tiro hee threescore nine yeeres age hee buried concerning whose writing speech went old time wrote well man wrote better ecclesiast hist left behind many scholers among gregorie bishop neocaesarea p valerianus august second time gallienus augustus p valerianus august third time gallienus august second time gothes breake asia wasting spoiling trebell pollio temple diana ephesus burnt iornandes p valerius maximus acilius glabrio p valerianus august fourth time gallienus august third time eight persecution christian valerianus first yeere empire eusebius witnesseth milde gracious christian afterwards perswasion certaine aegyptian magician bitterly cruelly persecuted christian also given artmagicke learned master iniquity cut tender bowel infant offer men woman sacrifice sapores sapor king persian layeth siria cilicia cappodocia waste treb pollio cornelius bishop rome cyprian bishop carthage whose writing every word maner savor martyrdome beheaded one rome carthage cassiodor p aurelius memmius fuscus pomponius bassus valerian puissant army taketh journy warre upon sapores souldiers gaulesalute posthumus emperour pannonia ingenuus armie stiled emperour vopi c pomp laetus p fulvius aemilianus pomponius bassus second time persecution holdeth still valerianus gallienus ecclesiast hist one paulus deacon beganne first keepe wildernesse leade eremite life hieronymus ingenuus gallienus overthrowen whole army put sword regillianus maesians made emperour vanquished sarmatians roxolanes killed feare infested gallienus pom laet aureolus illyricum obtaines empire p l cornelius seculatis second time iunius donatus valerianus ruled empire sonne gallienus seven yeeres encountring mesopotamia persian strucke battaile wherein discomsited taken prisoner sapores yeere age miserable perpetuall servitude lived rest yeeres among parthian king whensoever get upon horse used necke bowing stouping underneath steed footestoole sort valerian forced mount king vp saddle hand backe gallienus moved calamity father affrighted manifest judgement god graunted peace againe unto church proclamation edict remitted eased persecution eusebius others empire gallienus usurped imperiall dignity diver place sundry time going name tyrant called emperours trebell pollio others p gallienus augustus fourth time petronius volusianus gallienus saluteth valerianus yonger brother owne son gallienus caesar jointly reigneth german frank great power forcibly invade italie killing spoiling untill come farre ravenna eusebius orosius aemilianus aegypt assumed imperiall robe theodorus taketh prisoner tr pollio odenatus king palmyrenes taketh upon empire east great foughten field vanquisheth persian much put sapores flight encamped hard ctesiphon tr pollio macrianus father together macrianus quietus sonnes became emperours macriani aureolus usurper empire illyricum slaine battaile quietus within killed odenatus tr pollio errour chiliast together heresy sabellius samosatenus trouble church euseb p gallienus augustus fifth time ap pomponius faustinus terrible plague reigneth rome elsewhere many great earthquake happen fearefull darkenes many day together treb pollio p numnrius albinus maximus dexter gothes waste greece macedonie pontus asia inrodes barbarian sore shaketh province tr pollio cassiodor iornandes quadi sarmatians seize hand pannonia euseb p gallienus aug sixth time aemilius saturninus frank saxon german breake gaule euseb odenatus holdeth whole empire east tr pollio p valerianus caesar second time l cesonius macer locillus ruf ianus franckes saxon german enter also spaine euseb odenatus assumed gallienus felowship empire stiled augustus tr pollio posthumius sonne posthumus killed seventh yeere empire among gaules traine lollianus laid trebell pollio theheresie samosatenus oppugned authoritie synod godly learned pastor church eusebius p gallienus aug seventh time sabimlius frank saxon german conduct antharius lutterus sonnes bartherus marbodus king saxos force tarraco city spaine lay even ground euseb trithemius odenatus ambush maeonius cousin german laid sonne herode slaine victorinus posthumus made copanion kingdome gaule killeth lollianus alone obtaineth soveraigne rule among gaules tr pollio p ovinius paternus arcesilaus zenobia wife odenatus together sonnes herennianus timolaus holdeth kingdome east tr pollio victorinus slain agrippina abusing body wife matron marius kept empire day marius bin smith likewise killed tetricus entred upon empire sundry occurrent event length aurelianus laid downe imperial dignitie promoted sundry honour tr pollio p ovinius paternus second time marinianus aureolus emperour illyricum hee put tetricus flight concluded peace gallienus soone dissolved broken gallienus together brother millaine souldiers aureolus slaine march tr pollio gallienus succeeded avrelivs flavivs clavdivs ruled one yeere ten moneths fifteene day p aurel fl claud aug second time ovinius paternus claudius emperor vanquished aureolus disseiseth empire subdueth gothes wasting illyricum macedonia battel slew tr pollio p flavius antiochianus furius orfitus fourth day february claudius dieth succeeded aurelius quinctilius brother twentieth day february killed claudius succeedeth l domitivs avrelivs valer avrelianvs governed empire foure yeeres eleven moneths seven day giveth suevians sarmatians overthrow marcomans wasted italie overcommeth placentia fl vopiscus aurelianus severe rigorous bloodie prince killed sister daughter small cause military discipline hee kept severely souldier committed adultery hoasts wife punished maner caused top tree bent downeward tied unto feete said souldier dainly suffred go back againe poore wretch rent insunder hanged halfe side vnto deputy lievtenant generall hee wrote wise thou wilt captaine commaunder nay thou wilt enjoy thy life conteine thy souldiours hand man hardy take away men good let none trample corne feete let souldier content allowance live enemy spoile provincialles teares let wage belt taverne taphouse aurelianus vopiscus writeth thus many reckon neither among good prince bad wanted clemencie principall vertue prince himselfe saith necessary prince rather good p aurelianus pomponius bassus seditious broile arose rome while emperor maketh warre marcomans vopiscus constantinus magnus afterwardes emperour yeere borne britanny whose father constantius mother helena bucholcer samosatenus declared heretike cast church eusebius others p quietus voldumianus marcomans warre dispatched author foresaid sedition rome grievously punished aurelianus vanquisheth barbarian illyricum thracia cannabas leader gothes killeth side danubius vopiscus p claudius tacitus afterward called augustus moecius memmius balburius furius placidianus barbarian subdued aurelianus marcheth east recovereth many peeces beene lost vanquisheth queene zenobia taketh prisoner one firmius seizeth aegypt hand keepeth soone valerianus great captaine recovered vopiscus p imp aurelianus august second time c iulius capitolinus aurelianus triumpheth enemy vanquished buildeth temple unto sunne fortifieth rome stronger walles round delivereth vindelici barbarian siege setteth hee forward warrelike expedition illyricum proclaimeth warre upon persian vopiscus ninth persecution christian aurelianus proclaimed occasion death interrupted impeached wherefore reckon among tenne persecution p imp aurelianus augustus third time annonius marcellinus became never reclaimed better minded notwithstanding thunderbolt fell violently hard nay rather wrote mandate utter destruction christian church done betwixt heraclea bizantium hee owne company slaine day ianuary decease continued interreigne vacancy eight moneths vopiscus eusebius orosius onuphr aurelianus succeeded clavdivs tacitvs reigned six moneths day prince adorned many vertues singularly wel accepted senate vop eut p imp tacitus august second time fulvius aemilianus dispatched put death murdred aurelianus tacitus enforced barbarian broken forth maeotis returne backe againe thither sixt moneth say hee murdered treacherous practise owne souldiers others affirme surcharged faction heart broken wit crackt thought died vopisc florianvs whole brother tacitus brother tooke empire upon owne motion held scarce two moneths killed souldiers tarsus heard probus emperour armie elected tacitus therefore succeeded avrel valer probvs ruled five yeeres foure moneths noble warriour mightie feates armes senate wished souldiers chose people rome open acclamation called vertues brave exploites fl vopiscus hath described madnesse cursed heresie manichee entred many part world p imp aurel probus augustus second time furius lupus probus recovereth gaule german possessed put sword eutro regained city barbarian hand vopiscus p imp aurel probus augustus third time ovinius paternus probus vanquished german subdued also sarmatians illyricum overcame nation getes thracia upon submission tooke favour friendship vopiscus thence marched east p iunius messalagratus probus tooke palfurius puissant brigand prisoner slew freed isauria quieted partes pamphilia subdued blemmies graunted peace unto parthian persian suite request returned thracia hee planted hundred thousand bastarnae nation gepidians gothes vandales assembled together roman ground vopisc p imp aurel probus augustus fourth time c iunius tibetinus saturninus aspiring east empire probus overcome bonosus proculus agrippina make emperours gaule usurpe therewith britanny spaine gaule braccata probus overthrew gepidians gothes vandales rebelled diver time sundry victory subdued received rome magnificent triumph exhibited vnto people sumptuous shewes vopisc p imp aurel probus august fifth time pomponius victorinus probus exactor militarie discipline enemy idle person withall desirous end war while hee addresseth himselfe persian warre journeied illyricum treacherously souldiers killed second day november howbeit afterwards souldiers together erected mighty great sepulchre title inscription lieth emperour probus truely called probus good conquerour barbarous nation conquerour also tyrant see vopiscus succeeded avrelivs carvs together sonnes carinvs nvmerianvs reigned one yeere p imp aurel carus aurel sonne august carinus cesar carvs taking hand persian warre probus prepared together sonne numerianus gained mesopotamia came farre cresiphon lightning consumed vopiscus p aurel carinus augustus second time aurel numerianus august second time c valer diocletianvs iovivs saluted emperour reigned twenty yeeres numerianus father lawe wife father aper slaine dryas gaule diocletian yet privateman beene tolde witch wise woman emperour killed aper signifieth wilde bore hunted oft killed many one missed still empire would often say many bore slaine others go away still sweet venison length owne hand ranne aper aforesaid praefect praetorium sword thought himselfe surely invested empire fl vopiscus carinus fought many field diocletian last battell murgum vanquished suffered due punishment wickednesse murdered tribune captaine whose wife hee committed adultery vopisc eutrop aurel vict p imp diocletian aug second time aristobulus many commotion certaine region empire also certaine vsurpers tyrant soone put downe oppressed pomp laetus p iunius priscillianus maximus second time tiu aquilinus maximianvs hercvlivs diocletian made partner empire created philonianus constantius joineth battaile sapores king persian worst constans leading wanton voluptuary life draweth thereby principall captaines magnentius rest assaile set upon himselfe zosim sigon p sergius nigrinianus magnentius killeth constans gaule hand one f gaiso hee maketh decentius desiderius two brother caesar possesseth himselfe gaule spaine italie nepotianus hearing death constans usurpeth empire italie within captaines magnentius slaine vetrannio likewise catcheth empire pannonia zosim zonar constantius hearing constans death maketh agreement king sapores revenged magnentius returneth constantinople seduced perswaded arians persecuteth athanasius bishop true sincere beliefe full craftily hee draweth away vetrannio magnentius would forced fight two zosimus sigon p cosulship sergius nigrianus magnentius tyrannizeth upon certaine roman nobility constantius rejecteth vetrannio declareth caesar gallus cousin german sonne uncle sonne constantine brother openly favoreth arians oros eutrop socrat sozom victor p imp constantius augustus fiftt time fl constantius gallus aesar constantius maketh warre upon magnenttus mursa overthrowne constantius afterwards ticinum giveth roman overthrow zosimus p imp constantius august sixt time fl onstantius gallus caesar second time magnentius vanquished gaule constantius slew himselfe decentius brother caesar owne hangman desiderius submitteth himselfe constantius assumeth joint empire east west arles exhibiteth game play arians solicited sommoneth generall cnuncell holden millaine zosim zonaras sigon p imp whereof solloweth briefe constantius while hee intendeth warre lentienses almans causeth gallus caesar east committed foule wicked fact brought unto commandeth hee killed istria hee vanquisheth almans whole armie distemperature aire soile forced alter journey cap last certaine skirmish battailes fought forgetting take cuirace hasting fight mortally wounded unknowne person within yeelded vitall breath two thirtieth yeere age six twentieth day iune lib cap succeeded fl iovianvs reigned seven moneths two twenty dayes chosen souldiers departeth persia concluded peace sapor yeelded province beyond tigris marcellinus lib cap p imp flavius iovianus august fl varronianus august sonne childe iovianus dieth galatia lib cap succeeded fl valentinianvs chosen souldiers reigned eleven yeeres eight moneths two twenty dayes returned constantinople tooke unto society empire brother fl valens declared augustus hee committed unto east empire ruled fourteene yeeres foure moneths fourteene day himselfe tooke progresse west marcell lib cap p imp valentinianus augustus imp valens augustus while valentinian thinkes making warre upon alemans valens procopius usurper troubled wearied li cap p fl gratianus ionne valentinian fl dagalaiphas procopius apprehended hath head strucken lib ca marcellus giving attempt succeed fl dagalaiphas procopius within put death cap feareful earthquake throughout world cap valentinian three battailes conduct iovinus discomfiteth almans making warre lib cap p fl lupicinus fl iovinus bloodie sedition rome betweene damasus vrsicinus contending episcopall dignity arintheus warre quadi justly begun unhappily managed lib cap theodosius yonger brave yong gentleman represseth sarmatians cap p imp valentinianus augustus fourth time imp valens aug time para king armenia commaundement valens murdered feast lib cap p imp gratianus aug time fl equitius valentinian maketh warre upon alemans entreth league amitie king macrianus lib cap wofull condition state east province valens cap p third consulship gratianus august fl equitius valentinianus journey sarmatians illyrian giveth audience embassador quadi much enchafed vexed speech surprized apoplexie dieth seventeenth day november libr cap dead valentinian sonne childe army stiled augustus cap p imp valens aug time imp valentinianus junior aug permission valens gothes hun oppressed passing danubius received thracia misused roman captaines governor set upon roman ammianus marcellinus lib cap p imp gratianus august time fl merobaudes valens giveth order meete tumult gothes made thracia receive great overthrow notwithstanding roman cause much sorrow lib cap gratianus happily endeth warre lentienses libr cap valens advauncing gothes envying glorie gratian vanquished slaine thracia cap thus endeth chronologie marcellinus storie
